Reviews.Title: “A Total Rewards member dream!”
Reviews.Author: spudnett2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful hotel during a four day stay in August. I was excited that all nights were comped, and I had enough credits for one buffet, which I could have passed on. The food in the buffet was not good, and taste like cafeteria food. The casinos' slots were tight, but we still had fun playing. This hotel is within walking distance to many attractions. Parking is outrageous!!! but thanks to the total rewards card, merely playing 30 minutes each day, parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: Service, from the moment you enter until you depart is excellent. Due to confusion about my arrival date, I was upgraded to a penthouse suite, complete with baby grand piano, can't complain about that. The suite was on the top floor, views fabulous and immaculately clean. Amenities were great, loved the espresso machine and everything else. Whenever you pass an employee there is a greeting and inquiry of what can be done to improve your stay. Cannot say enough about the hospitality and top notch service of Harrah's New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “I thought Harrahs of New Orleans was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: xaviersmom62
Reviews.Content: We stayed Labor day weekend, I booked way in advance so I got a much better rate. They had storm issues during the week and I was afraid we were not going to be able to stay there. This hotel is absolutely beautiful. We are a total rewards member and have stayed at alot of different Harrahs and this one so far was our #1 pick. It was just beautiful from the lobby to the elevator to the room. This was our third trip to New Orleans and the first one where we could find a reasonable rate to be able to afford to stay at this hotel, and it was well worth it. The bathroom is huge, the colors used in the room was so gorgeous. The hotel is centrally located so you can walk all around the downtown area. We have won at the casino the last two times we have been there and it has a mardi gras theme and is so beautiful. Also I love that when you put your players card in you can order a drink from the slot machine and do not have to flag a waitress down.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLadyAnn
Reviews.Content: My Granddaughter and I visited in August 2012. The rooms are beautiful, the views from higher floors is special and the staff were very friendly and helpful every day of our 4 day stay. Location is great for touring the French Quarter. We took the streetcar which is only 1 block away to get to the Jackson Square area and the French Market areas. French Quarter starts only 1 block away if one would just want to walk to the sites. And in the evening there is an underground walkway from the hotel to the casino so it's very safe to come and go. We loved the hotel and will definitely stay here when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very nice, casino I doubt if I will be back.”
Reviews.Author: KraZynTn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, hotel employees beyond helpful, room was great with great riverview overlooking July 4th firework show. I The casino was tight but thats normal. I did go through the tunnel to get to the casino which they say is safer but when you are alone in the tunnel by yourself at anytime, one wonders about how safe they really are walking alone. Yes, I am sure there is security but just the idea how fast can security get to you if you are assaulted or robbed in the tunnel. I started just walking out the casino door and across the intersection to get to the hotel. I did have an experience with a homeless man, I assume he was homeless with his pillowcase full of whatever playing the slots beside me. I won a small jackpot and he started cursing me out. I notified a slot attendent and the man had taken off. She said, next time just push the help button if he does it again. I thought, that doesnt solve the problem the man is still in the casino bothering people. I went to the other side of the casino and there he was again. He came up to me and said something about you gonna win another jackpot which should be mine. I just left and went back to my hotel room and next morning was glad it was time to go home. I didnt like the way I felt, unsafe inside the casino and in the tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: jpressly2791
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at Harrah's Hotel and Casino in New Orleans. Overall, I will say the stay was fine. The staff were very friendly and remembered me by name every time I walked through the lobby. The room was nice and comfortable. I had the pleasure of being upgraded to a suite so my room was a nice little escape. I was an early check-in and somehow the room had shown in the computer as ready but when I went in the room, it had not been completely serviced (i.e. dirty washcloths in the shower, last customers soaps still in the shower, trash items not emptied). I called the front desk and within minutes the housekeeping staff was there and had the room serviced for me. The convention center space looks very nice for the conference that I was attending. However, the internet was painfully slow throughout the convention center. The rooms we were in had a projector that was not functioning properly and could not be focused. While the staff was very gracious and replaced it with a newer one, the inconveniences slowed the pace of the conference and got it off to a bit of a rocky start. If they update their network infrastructure and audio/visual equipment it would help the rating on this location tremendously. As a business traveler I rely on my ability to communicate via the internet and this was very much an issue here. It just didn't seem like a Harrah's standard of service. As far as the location goes, all I can say is that you are within walking distance of great entertainment and great food. Bourbon street is about a 7 minute walk from the hotel, several great restaurants are within less than 5 minutes walk. All in all, nothing just overwhelming with this hotel/convention center. I would stay here again, but if I was presenting I would make sure I had my own wireless hotspot and my own projector. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joe c
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel stay. Very good location with lots of attractions nearby. Hotel well managed & maintained. Very good staff that are very helpful & friendly. Rooms are very nice also. The business center has free computers/printer that can be used 24/7

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: whatmeow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August. The employees were very friendly, each time we passed the front desk they would say have a good day. We like to gamble so stopped in the casino often on way back from wandering the French Quarter. The hotel's proximity to the streetcar stop came in handy also. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, will stay again on leisure travel”
Reviews.Author: zc12_jen
Reviews.Content: OK, objectively, I think it is slightly below the usual 5 star standard. Let's put it this way, if I were to travel on business, I would deifintely try another hotel, but if I were to pay out of my own pocket, I will be happy to stay there again (i think it's a good deal at $160/night weekdays) Slightly below my usual 5 star standards because 1) when i first stepped into the room, it smells this cheap chemical air refresher smell that I really really hate. 2) amenities are on the cheaper side. 3) it lacks character, nothing stood out. otherwise, i really have no complaints and am completely happy with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: texasredtop
Reviews.Content: I love Harrah's in New Orleans and we just had another perfect 4 night stay there. Their personnel are very helpful and professional. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's my favorite hotel in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: shelljo
Reviews.Content: We walked into Harrahs at about 10:00AM, we gave our bags to the bellhop and went to pre-register,not expecting our room to be ready before 3pm (check-in is actually 4:30). The girl told us they had a room ready. We went upstairs and it wasn't ready so I called the front desk and spoke to Nicole she apologized and said to come and get the key for a different room. Meanwhile the bellhop met us on the way down. We went to our second room and like the first one it wasn't ready. This time the bellhop called the front desk. He gave me the phone and Nicole apologized again saying there must have a been a computer glitch and that they wanted to update us to a suite (I was traveling with my cousin) with a King Bed. Not expecting a room that early in the first place it really wasn't an inconvenience, but we said if it was really ready we would take it. When we got to the suite Nicole was there checking it out to be sure it was ready for us. So, we had a beautiful suite for $69 a night. Everything was spotless, no dust , nothing. Rooms were beautiful, bed was comfortable, view was great, bathroom huge and beautifully decorated, refrigerator, wet bar, what a pleasure. Every single person at Harrah's was polite and friendly and helpful, as were all of the other people we came into contact with. I love the Harrahs/Caesars chain and look forward to my next stay at one of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE Harrah's in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: klynne2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrah's in New Orleans three times and we can't wait to go back. The staff is so friendly and welcoming and helpful. We needed a fridge on our first trip for some medication and they gave us a suite. The rooms are immaculate, the beds are luxuriously comfy, and the service is truly outstanding. The food at Ruth's Chris and Besh was five star. The huge buffet in the casino is so sumptious you won't want to eat for hours. The crab legs and seafood were fresh and delicious, the desserts were decadant, and the selection was massive. There was too much to explore in one meal, we went back three times over the course of our stay in New Orleans. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! It gives a great name to Southern Hospitality! PLUS the hotel is right on the trolley car route so in a few steps you can board for about a $1 and be anywhere in New Orleans you need to go including Cafe du Monde, French Market, Cemetaries, Bourbon Street, etc. We did not need a rental car nor did we use taxis. It was just a great location for sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: CtFamilyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference, at first a little concerned being a casino and all. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the hotel. From the minute I walked in to the time I Ieft, there was always someone willing to help me or welcome me. Marvin was a true gentleman and ambassador to the hotel, always there to assist you if needed. I was worried that the casino would be noisy and dirty in the hotel. However, the rooms are separate from the casino. The casino is across the street and connected by a tunnel if the weather is bad. Thus, no noise from there. One never has to set foot in there if you do not want to. The rooms were very large and nice, bathrooms were great with a sitting tub and a shower area. Extra large sitting area to move around in. Very happy with the rooms, and they were very quiet. Ruth Chris is in the hotel. Concierge is right there also. Morning papers are not delivered but can pick up a USA today or local paper for free at the main desk. Riverwalk (shops) and the Hilton are right next door with Dragos in the Hilton. There is also a pub/brewery restaurant next door. Also, some restaurants in the casino. Thus, very good food is real close by. Bourbon street is a few blocks away about a good 10 minute walk. Canal street about 5 min away for tourist shops and fast food like McD. and Arbys. Draw backs - they charge you for wireless in the room like most major hotels and no pool. (can swim in pool next door) All in all a great hotel, great service and super friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: JoeyH01
Reviews.Content: Our Harrah's room was spacious and clean. The hotel is just a short walk to Canal Street or the French Quarter. The riverfront streetcar line is just across the street, as well, so it's easy to get to Jackson Square or the French Market. Close to the attractions, but not in the midst of what can be some craziness at night. The front desk staff is super friendly. In fact, everyone at both the hotel and the adjacent casino really embodied the principles of southern hospitality. This is a large, modern property, though. There's nothing about it that makes it "New Orleans" in design or mood. If you're OK with that, then this is a good choice. If, though, you're looking for a NOLA atmosphere, you might consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Must be 21 for the buffet?”
Reviews.Author: TimeToTravel097
Reviews.Content: We booked our one night stay at Harrah's that afternoon and they even allowed my family of four to check in early, great service at this point. Plenty to do within walking distance including the casino. The one big drawback we had is our youngest daughter is only 19 and you must be 21 to eat at the Harrahs Casino Buffet. I understand to gamble, but to eat? We've taken our kids to other casino buffets (three different states) and they've always been allowed to eat in the buffet casino. It's a poor design on Harrah's part in the logistics of getting to the buffet. We talked to everyone at the hotel, but no one could make a decision. It was very disappointing to all.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Just dirty”
Reviews.Author: KEVAN725
Reviews.Content: I expected so much more from you Harrah's! Hair, dust, sticky stuff (with hair in it), food on the carpet in multiple places, beds made halfway, and the coffee mugs had old dry coffee in them from the last guests!!! Called the desk and yes they were polite but nothing changed. I left the room and immediately got a call saying that my complaints could not be verified because I wasn't in the room when someone came to check on it. But then I was told that the room had been cleaned. Lies. Came back to the same dirty room. Disgusting! My boss paid for this room, but I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is always welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: mikec
Reviews.Content: My father and I just recently completed a 2 night stay at Harrahs N.O. August 4-6. I've stayed here several times but have never completed a review. I figured that they have been so consistent, that I ought to give them some credit. From the time we checked-in to the time we checked-out, everyone that we encountered was professional and generally seemed genuinely caring. The rooms are all very well appointed. They are classy but not stuffy. The hotel is very close proximity to just about anything you want to get too. The thing that makes this hotel what it is however, are the employees. Feel free to email me with specific questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: Our room was super nice and all of the staff was very friendly and courteous. The location is very good and is within walking distance of the French Quarter. The casino was very nice as well. Many places to eat and drink close by. We would stay at Harrah's again without hesitation. As far as paying for the wifi, we didn't. The desk gave us a code to use free of charge-just ask.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and great view of might mississippi”
Reviews.Author: misspatrick1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited new orleans for the first time 1/28/12. We picked Harrahs as we have playerscard. We had a wonderful, clean room with a comfy bed, huge bathroom, and EXCELLENT view of the mighty mississippi. The staff was very friendly, always greeting us in passing. Great location and dont forget to eat at MANNINGS as the po boy, sweet potato skins, and bloody mary are very tasteful. For breakfast the famous MOTHERS is just a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Billye G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and rooms are nice. Great view of the Mississippi river. Just 2 blocks from the French Quarter. The hotel is completely seperate from the casino so you dont have the constant noise or smell of smoke.I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Great to stay and play, the staff is friendly and courteous, the good is good, the casino is always hopping. The best thing is it's centrally located so you can step outside to a plethora of other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen items and no follow up”
Reviews.Author: kas5955667
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the room and location but when I had several items stolen from my room.I tore the room apart looking for my bag and then I had to spend many hours with very detailed reports with the investigator. In addition, I was put in the uncomfortable situation of the manager bringing in the cleaning lady and having to confront her when he should have handled it.This wasted almost a whole day of my vacation time! Here it is over a month later and after all this time they will not return my phone calls or let me know what the status is. I have left several messages with the security manager, Mike Parr and also the general manager, Sean Cooper.All I can say is nothing is safe in your room and no one will follow up!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for children (If it's not already obvious).”
Reviews.Author: S51438
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Harrah's in New Orleans was a mixed bag. Good: The lobby is very attractive. The hotel is located only about a block from the French Quarter. Separate tub and shower in the bathroom. Had a nice view of the Mississippi River. The hotel room had good lighting. Bad: The bathroom door didn't lock. The connecting door's door handle was broken, so it had to be pushed open. (We had 2 connecting rooms) There was no free-wifi, it costs $11 a day. There is only a steakhouse on site. There is no where to get breakfast at the hotel, unless you order expensive room service. There is no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Found a bed bug on me/pillow, they did nothing for us except move us to a room 2 doors down.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole0102
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice at first glance. The curtain headboard had an inch of dust on it, coffee pot had toilet paper where the water goes(took 45 min. for them to bring up a new one, then that one quit working) Cigarette burns on comforter. And the worse part was the bed bug that was crawling on my arm right by my sons head!! Housekeeping came in and said "Yep, that's a bed bug." and walked out! Manager came in and brought new pillows....you would think they would at least be apologetic. I have sent 2 emails to them and have had no response! I really had high expectations for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: adam1966
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and clean. I asked for a smoking room, but they put me in non-smoking. Phoned down to be told there were no smoking rooms available. Went down and asked again at the desk, and the very nice lady that checked me in, said of course, and I changed rooms right away. Made me wonder what the person I phoned was on about. Maybe couldn't be bothered? Maybe just mistaken? Staff were all really friendly and helpful. The $10 wi-fi was horrendous. Painfully slow, when it worked at all. Wi-fi should be fast and free in this day and age. Bottled water left in the room was $6!!! That is a disgrace! How can a hotel justify this amount? All in all though, the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “great experience at harrah's”
Reviews.Author: msmac63
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Harrah's in New Orleans! The room was modern, very clean and had some nice little extras that I don't usually see....Evian bottles of water, complimentary umbrella (which I found humorous) and the room safe was free of charge.....I usually have to pay a fee for this in other hotels. The room was exceptionally quiet....never heard a peep the entire week. Played the slots every evening (never came out ahead but had fun) Enjoyed the breakfast/lunch buffet every day (comped...but a reasonable price of 12.99 if you are paying cash). The hotel is a short walk from the casino...but all underground with escalators. I especially liked that the hotel was so close to the French Quarter...a short walk to the steamboat and street cars and great shopping! I was there at the same time as American Idol auditions and Lutheran Youth conference of 33,000 kids so it was wall-to-wall kids on the streets! I definitely recommend Harrah's and look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Casino Hotel Royal”
Reviews.Author: ALTraveler2012
Reviews.Content: If you ever travel to New Orleans, the Harrah's Hotel & Casino is a MUST STAY. Best Hotel in town. The rooms are huge. Bathrooms are the best with stand alone glass shower and huge soaking bathtub. The only down fall is the casino is not connected to the hotel but it is right across the street which is a hop, skip, & a jump to winning lots of money (or at least having a good time trying)... Ruth Chris Steak House is Delish and is located in the lobby of the hotel!!! I went for a lovers weekend and plan to return again soon. If you register for the casino rewards points, you'll even get offers for discounted rooms (ours was free on Thursday. only had to pay the 11.00 in fees). Rooms there can go upwards of 250.00-350.00 so free is the best deal ever. New Orleans is a must see. I hated that it rained all weekend while I was there but did get to venture out to a few locations. Of course Bourbon Street is a must see (Party Hardy), but I also liked Magazine Street (lots of vintage shops). Gotta give a shout out to Juan's Flying Burrito... Best Mexica Food Ever!! Have fun if you get to New Orleans BA-BBBY (that was my attempt of the New Orleans accent :)

Reviews.Title: “Our NOLA trip”
Reviews.Author: Trudy05
Reviews.Content: We traveled from NJ to New Orleans for a 5 night stay. We are diamond in the total rewards program. We had 2 rooms, one on the 20th floor with a river view, and our comp room was upgraded to a beautiful suite. Everyone(door men,front desk,housekeeping,concierge,restaurants,valet,casino employees)went out of their way to greet us and to smile..Cant wait to go back...Great customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and nice”
Reviews.Author: ateach
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of Harrah's hotels and this one beats many of them. Obviously it's newer than the others. The room (1518) was so spacious, clean, and near the ice machine (very important) and elevators. Besides the comfortable king size bed there was a couch, coffee table, 2 uphostered chairs, desk, end tables, a bench at the foot of the bed, great lighting and a flat screen tv. The large bathroom had a huge tub, small separate shower and a little toilet room. The contemporary decor included artistic photos of places around the city. There is a fitness center but I didn't visit it and there is no pool or spa. Employees were friendly and helpful. I did have a problem with getting enough towels everyday, but the manager assurred me that it wasn't a hotel issue but something with the linen source and was being addressed. The casino is attached to the hotel by an underground tunnel or you can walk across the street. There are a number of restaurants in and next to the hotel, Ruth's Chris is one, and plenty of them within walking distance. The trolley is not right outside the door but near by. Valet parking is $34 a day so I recommend self parking. If you play for 30 minutes in the casino you can get free parking by swiping your players card at the parking validation machine. Just a tip on this , if you take your vehicle out after it's sits there for more than a 24 hour period you will have to pay the difference, so my husband and I would swipe both of our cards (different #s) so that we would have two validation tickets and that took care of the cost of extra hours. One of the things I suggest you do besides roaming the French Quarter is visiting the National WWII Museum which is new, big and very informative if not moving. I also had a great time at the Old New Orleans Rum Distillery, www.oldneworleansrum.com. It's hard to find but they do offer a van transportation if you are on the east end of the French Quarter. I would definately stay at Harrah's New Orleans again especially if they give me the the great room rate I had for this stay. It pays to play as they say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay-- Staff very eager to help!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjblackjack
Reviews.Content: Never seen a staff so anxious to make your stay GREAT!! So freindly-- highly recommend---- so much more pleasant than the other Hotels close by. Easy to walk to anywhere--- parking is also free if you self park and gamble for 30 minutes a day. That alone saves you $100.00 on a 3 day stay

Reviews.Title: “Employees friendly, room view great”
Reviews.Author: Krazytn
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here now, our last day at the hotel, thinking of this past week. All employees at the hotel were always polite, helpful and made one feel welcomed. I wish they would have the fluffier pillows like the other Harrahs instead of these that get hard, use a pillow off the couch or bring one from home. I don't like the way they do parking. I called ahead and asked about hotel guest parking, they informed me diamonds have free parking so we did valet. Wrong, it's a good thing I asked at the desk again because it is 35 a night. I used my points to pay for first night then used the parking garage afterwards, which even as a hotel guest we had to get a validation ticket showing we gambled everyday. I would think they would have a ticket they could give you when you checked into the hotel you could just place inside your car window. Parking is confusing and seems every employee has a different outlook or knows nothing. The garage is always full, so parked on 9th majority of the time. I won't mention driving around New Orleans, apparently they can't afford street signs. ,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: eyetravel22
Reviews.Content: The Harrah's New Orleans staff are very friendly and willing to answer any question you my have about New Orleans or their property. The rooms are clean and comfortable (chairs are worn.) The bathroom has a separate room for the toilet, soaking tub and glass shower. Loved having the mini-frig and safe in the room. Next to the entrance is a light system for Do Not Disturb and Housekeeping services; no hang tags. There is an underground tunnel to the Harrah's Casino which is air conditioned, so you don't have to sweat or get rained upon. Gamblers get free parking through Harrah's Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: XtinaWalker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is even better in person! Spacious bathroom, nice size rooms, super comfortable bed and very nice all throughout the hotel. Friendly staff, loved our experience here, will recommend to others and definitely Come back!

Reviews.Title: “Crushed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: vuguru
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel ended up being much nicer than expected. Since the casino comped the room, I figured we would be put in crap box. Boy was I wrong! In fact the suite was nicer than 90 percent of hotel suites I've ever stayed at (check my reviews for comparison). The suite was large, with a comfortable bed. My wife loved the look of the modern dinning chairs. The service staff was great, especially the valet manager. He remembered my name and car only after seeing me drop off the car two nights earlier. This will probably Three things keep me from giving this place 5 stars: 1. The in-room internet is terrible!!!!!! 2. Front Desk was impossible to get on the phone at 8/9 am. Got through to them on the 6th try. 3. Sub par bathroom amenities. (Management: Please upgrade before our next stay). I will definitely come back and recommend it to people.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with hotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: a1copyguy
Reviews.Content: wife and I just returned from our 1st visit to harrahs nola, everything we had heard in regards to its amazing staff is so true. For starters,let me just say that I have become very spoiled from my usual travel destination caesars palace in vegas ,so considering i am used to their best rooms let me just add as far as room quality and service i am more than happy to say that i was very pleased and loved the quality of our room very much. we had 24th floor with a view of the river(rm#2403) we found it as special in nola to look out at the river as we do looking out our vegas window and watching the bellagio fountains. we are not pool ppl,despite it being probably the hottest days they have had this summer while we wwere there so i cant complain about the lack of a pool. It may take some getting used to someone at every turn saying hello or welcome back but its still a nice touch. my only honest complaint in regards to the property was a lack of an on site gift shop, you still had to actually go thru the passage way into the casino to get something you may have forgotten or the usual unexpected things we get from hotel gift shops,be advised,its not open 24 hours,and actually does not open until 10am,not sure what time it closes. at 1st for a new visiter to nola, being told a place you are looking for is just a block over may seem intimidating when the streets around harrahs seem to go at weird angles,but it only took us a day to feel as if we knew where we were goinjg when it came to finding shops and the fq,or even just catching the trolly. as far as the casino,I didnt at all feel it was as smokey as i had read priopr to our trip,but it was very crowded on a saturday,and being used to vegas sized casinos i did feel the selection of slot machines was not as i had hoped. many max bets were higher than the ones i like to play in vegas.but I am here to rate the hotel not the casino. the beds were possibly as comfy as any ive ever slept in. houskeeping was almost silent and never had any issue with noise on our floor. going back to its lack of an onsite gift shop,we enjoyed some in room adult beverages and thats where buying your mixers befor hand may come in handy,there are vending machines which will run you approx 3 bucks a coke . beshi steak house was a real treat. i had a bone in sirloin that was out of this world,wife loved her prime rib. with both of us less seafood fans than most ppl in nola should be we found the buffet our main disapointment, not only for dinner,but we were suprised by the odd hours for breakfast,please check when you arrive the exact times because on weekends the buffet switches to brunch at some point befor 10am, so you will end up paying a much higher price for sleeping in just a little longer. i would highly reccomend even if you dont wish to gamble using the casino entrance when going to the french quarter or canal street coming and going, its an easy walk thru the casino,and by far a huge relief from the heat. elevators to rooms run very fast and the overall feelings i had all over the property was that everyone just seemed happy to be there. If we should decide to return to new orleans i wouldent hesitate to stay anywhere else. If you are more of a casino person like myself feel free to contact me in regards to any pluses or minuses I felt in regards to the gaming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: espears
Reviews.Content: A great hotel close to everything spacious rooms and friendly hotel staff the only thing missing is there is no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in great city!”
Reviews.Author: dsm640
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Harrah's in New Orleans for four nights starting 6/14/12. The rooms in the hotel were spacious, clean and well maintained. The staff was polite and helpful. Many attractions are within walking distance. The trolley stops nearby and the city tour picks up at the hotel. After reading some earlier reviews, I was leery of the walkway to the Harrah's Casino since I have trouble walking. But with two escalators and a ramp, the walk was fairly easy. We were disappointed by the dinner price of the buffet. The four nights we were there, the buffet included crabs which changed the priced to $32 pp. But it have us the chance to dine at many of the local restaurants nearby. We plan to return - had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “I Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. There wasn't a problem with the stay, it's just that when spending $450 a night, you expect a little luxury. Doorman... Sometimes. Sheets & Towels... Equal to a Motel 6. Room size... On the small size. Overall this is a basic motel that is tall and has the Harrah's name attached to it.

Reviews.Title: “Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: lastrose21131
Reviews.Content: My partner and I really enjoyed our stay at Harrah's New Orleans for a bi-annual gathering of Seniors who are active in community performing arts. Great venue and the staff was extremely helpful when tourist-type information was requested. While I do not like 90+ degree weather, I found things to do between the performances in air-conditioning. When you are in a city like New Orleans, you do not need a pool so why pay for it. While others in our group had river views on higher floors, our room had parking lot view but was cleaner than most upscale hotels that I have visited and the beds were so comfortable that I am going to order one for my home. The room is very organized and not the least bit fussy. When I travel I like comfort but I really, really appreciate simplicity with comfort. The Grand Isle Restaurant attached to the Harrah's complex was superlative in every way but especially for my favorite seafood - oysters. The staff again, top shelf. My best memory after the performances by great friends was the New Orleans Museum of Art and Sculpture Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Charm and Beautifully Decorated”
Reviews.Author: afreudgirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here as a two day get away with my husband and two friends. Being a TotalRewards member, I was able to get a very good price on the room which is why I chose to stay here. The staff was very nice and even let my friend check in before me, even though I had forgotten to put her name on the reservation. They simply called me to verify my information - no muss, no fuss! The registration area was beautiful as were the elevators. The room was beautiful (both bedroom and bathroom) and felt very posh. No detail was ignored. As an example, guests indicate whether they would like room service or privacy by pushing a button. There is even a door bell. One odditity - there were only two bath towels in the bathroom. The front desk brought more quickly but I thought it strange I needed to request them. The location is also nice. Though it is walkable to the French Quarter, it feels a world away from the low brow Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pestpilot
Reviews.Content: I was there on a business trip. I thought the hotel and its staff performed at or above expectations in all aspects. Good job!!! My only complaint was the view I had from my room on the fourth floor was of the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Segalini09
Reviews.Content: We have tried to stay here before, however rates are usually 400/night. Finally got a decent rate. The room was clean and comfortable. However it is not worth the price. Nothing makes it worth 400/night

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: docjph
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely redone. Bed is great, flat screen TV, Fridge, Bathroom has a tub and large stall shower. Staff is very very friendly. I will stay here again when we go back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's hotel and casino in NOLA is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl A
Reviews.Content: Our stay was June 1st - 4th. Harrah's hotel and casino was perfect. The hotel greeters and the entire staff were very friendly. The same for the casino staff. Our room was great. I have no complaints. The location is perfect. You can walk to Canal st. Bourbon st. The river walk. We are looking forward to going back in July. Thank you Harrah's hotel and casino of New Orleans. Sheryl Abrahams

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well-equipped, plenty of food options, poor direction signs”
Reviews.Author: tropicana49
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and had everything - refrigerator, huge soaking tub, separate shower, great TV, sitting area. A great view of the bay. The casino is in a separate building, but it has many dining options, including a 24 hour Fuddruckers. I'm not sure why a previous reviewer took a cab to the French Quarter, as it is a five minute walk - very safe with interesting shops. The hotel is also a three minute walk to the Aquarium and the tour boats - very convenient. Only complaint - this is a very congested area and the direction signs for parking were very poor (non-existent). The signs within the casino are also very limited. The casino is across the street from the hotel and requires using several escalators and a tunnel OR walking across two very busy streets. Staff went out of their way to be helpful - there was always a person (separate from the concierge) standing in the lobby ready to assist with directions or any other questions. We will definitely return, but not on a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Astrid S
Reviews.Content: I initially had a reservation at Harrah's but change of date left no availability. Stayed a block up at the Sheraton and it was equally unimpressive. But as for Harrah's. First coming up to the hotel from valet, the doors were missing handles. These are large, heavy, metal doors in the theme of the hotel and many of the doors were missing handles. Once inside, it wreaked of smoke. I know, it's a casino but I have been to others that had a much better filtration system. Next, the buffet was $35 per person. There were others in line before us and I watched people turn away from the cashier. When we approached, my husband asked what happened and the person said they didn't want to pay $35 each. We almost turned around too but he received a 25% discount for being military. So, it was only $50 something. As for the food, it was not impressive. The $35 tag was because it had seafood on the buffet. By seafood they meant crablegs. Since we don't eat crablegs it was a waste of money. I was underwhelmed by the hotel at the casino level so I am glad that I didn't stay in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but casino just ok”
Reviews.Author: gpreston24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a standard king room, 1315, with city-view. The view was nice, but would have been better if not partially blocked by the Loew's Hotel just across the street. Basically, I would rate this hotel room as excellent, completely comparable to other Harrah's hotels in which we have stayed. Spacious bathroom with separate potty closet; shower separate from tub. Single sink, but plenty of room on each side. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room contained a small refrigerator and a safe, an important feature in a casino hotel. We did not use the hotel's wifi, as there is an extra charge (I think $13.95). Instead, the AT&T cell signal was strong and provided satisfactory data service on my iPad. Every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous. A complaint I would have about this hotel is that restaurant facilities are lacking. Strangely, there is a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse inside the hotel itself, and then a separate upscale steak restaurant called Besh within the casino. We had a late lunch at the casino buffet on arrival, then breakfast there the next morning. I do not recommend eating at the buffet; in both quality and variety it does not meet the standards of most other casino buffets we have experienced. Also, the casino itself lacks a 24-hour cafe seen at others. For breakfast, I recommend Cafe Adelaide in Lowe's just across Peters St. from the hotel front door. (Try the French toast!) The cafe front door opens directly onto Peters. Another handy and moderately-priced restaurant we tried was Gordon Biersch, which we enjoyed and would recommend. As for the casino, it's about what you might expect--meaning smoky, noisy, crowded. Personally, if I had a choice I would go elsewhere; in this case I didn't have a choice. Also, we mostly played video poker. Many of the machines seemed poorly maintained and were not regularly kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Showing Wear”
Reviews.Author: rubberman9
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and accomadating,rooms beginning to show wear,stained furniture and such.Very clean.Frigid temperature in the casino so pack accordingly.Slot machines also frigid :)A little dissappointed in the room I recieved,no view,but I am a comped guest and won't hold it against them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Artemus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Harrah's New Orleans for six nights, April 29th through May 5th (checkout). Everything about our stay was top notch. We stayed in a standard room which was very nice. All the employees were very professional and very friendly. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: mels23
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here a few times and never a negative experience. This past stay I actually had a slight complaint...the light bulb went out and the fridge was wobbling. This is the biggest complaint I've ever had. It's pricey but you're gonna get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Rating Harrah's New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Arthur L
Reviews.Content: This property is squeaky clean and the staff very friendly and accommodating. In fact when we entered the lobby- there is a greeter who does greets and welcomes every person- whether yuo have just checked in or not. the housekeeping staff was so very attentive to our needs. I wish we had asked for a room facing the river- but it was very busy as there was the French Quarter festival. the casino is across the street so you have the choice of going there either thru a tunnel or walking across the street. there is a street car about a block away that takes you into the French Quarter. I do highly recommend this hotel. there is no pool

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were clean and staff was very attentive. Nice pillows on bed.”
Reviews.Author: Harvey5060
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the price. Staff was very much on top of any way they could be of help to guests needs. A smile from all who greeted you. I loved the room layout and there was plenty of space in drawers and closets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMMSeatte
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while attending a professional meeting. The location is good, the room was large and clean and the staff were very friendly. Their "thing" is greeting you when you return at the end of the day with "welcome back!" Watch out for the bathroom floor--smooth marble, which is slippery when wet. I slipped getting out of the shower and got a nasty bruise.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised by how much I liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoctorsK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights over a weekend and was pretty impressed with Harrah's. The staff inside was very friendly and helpful. Our room was pretty standard size, had a nice view of the river, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was huge, which was an added plus. Everything seemed fairly up to date and clean. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants--other than grab a drink at Ruth's Chris--so can't comment on their food. The casino is actually across the street from the hotel, but there is a walkway underground. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, very friendly, convenient”
Reviews.Author: advicebygrege
Reviews.Content: Our room was fantastic. 23rd floor with a great view. The staff at the hotel has always been very friendly and very helpful and on our recent trip, they were no different. We were there for 4 nights in April of 2012. Though the gym is small, it's adequate and clean. I used it 3 times while there to help work off Pat O'brien's bread pudding (the best we've had in New Orleans). The hotel is perfectly located across from the casino with underground tunnel access, and just a few blocks from the French Quarter. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: cmblazer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed there in March and had a wonderful time,The room wasnt ready when we arrived but that was OK cuz we went and ate and by the time we got back it was ready,Had a really pretty view of the water and the room was very nice,and clean.Hope next time I get my suite but the whole staff was great and very polite. I have never been in a nicer Harrahs, some of the Hotels are really in need of upgrading but this one was very nice. I can not say enough about the freindly people there and how helpful they are. Great Place to stay, will come again

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice but the room has an oddity”
Reviews.Author: 501casper
Reviews.Content: Had to make a last minute booking in NOLA -- Harrah's offered a nice price at a well located property. The bathroom was palatial -- the room was large and attractive -- BUT seemed odd when I realized that it did not have a desk! (and the TV was hidden behind a door flush with the wall) -- of course, perhaps, they want you to not spend much time in the room? -- But all in all, if you need sleeping quarters in NOLA, it is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and casino...”
Reviews.Author: DrewLuck
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with a great location. It is located on the edge of the French Quarter just a block away from Canal Street and only a couple more blocks from Bourbon Street. The hotel is VERY clean with a beautiful lobby, and nice clean rooms and corridors. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. The staff is on point with customer service. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, we were very well taken care of. The hotel has a secured tunnel that goes underground to get to the casino. It's a short and SAFE walk to get back and forth. It was nice to be able to avoid the public street late at night with cash in my pocket. I do see other reviews that mention this property is not kid friendly. No one should be bringing children to a city like New Orleans. There is NOTHING kid friendly about this town. It's an adult playground that should be left that way. I appreciate the level of security this establishment has. There is security at every single entrance to keep the teenagers and homeless out! For Harrah's safety, they cannot have anyone under the age of 21 on the casino floor, therefore no underage are allowed inside any casino doors. The dealers are friendly, the cocktail staff is quick and accurate, and the restaurants are good. The buffet was excellent. Keep in mind that there is no competition next door, so you may not find the same experience that you would in Vegas or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Minors not welcome, don't bother”
Reviews.Author: DKimmey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not kid friendly by any means. A majority of the hotel's food, like the buffet, Besh Steakhouse, Fuddruckers burgers, Starbucks, etc...are all within the casino building, making it ALL OFF-LIMITS to minors..and not just minors, anyone under 21....even if 20 yrs old, can't eat. Hotel has no pool. There's a tunnel from hotel to casino building so you can safely cross the street, except for anyone under 21. The website does NOT make any of this clear. For example, any mention of age in regards to the buffet is in the "Group Information" section....well, a small family isn't a "group" and not going to read it...it's hidden. Hotel room was fine, nothing special. There must have been some roadwork on the city view side, because all night there was a loud banging like a steel drum...I think it was cars driving over a steel manhole or something. Casino itself was good. Play was fine. Bourbon Street is nasty. Smells like poo and more. Superdome looks like brand new, like just built.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Missteps by this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: walker-roamer
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel adjacent to the casino and within easy walking distance of the French Quarter. This hotel boasts an very elegant lobby and a really great Ruth's Chris Steakhouse. They did not have a cafe for breakfast. The rooms were up to date and clean. Room safes and a small but empty refrigerator. Also a small single portion coffee maker. An improvement would be a couple of bottled water in the rooms. Beds were comfortable but the pillows were cheap with hard spots at the corners (weird). During our 2 day stay we were allowed only 3 bath towels. No washcloths or hand towels. We asked the maid for washcloths but she replied that the hotel didn't have enough for all the rooms. We never had this happen before. Would definitely stay here again because of the location and the friendly staff. Hopefully, when you stay they'll have more towels!

Reviews.Title: “Not completely satisfied with service”
Reviews.Author: MsNorm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs on April 6 and 7. When we arrived the room was not ready so they registered me and called when the room became available (about an hour later). We were put in room 1908 and the room was not clean (bed covers all on the floor, pillow cases dirty, potato chips all over the floor). I called the front desk to complain and they told me to hold on. As I was holding on the phone, the housekeeper knocked on the door and came to clean the room so we left. When we returned later to the room to put our luggage in, our key would not work and I heard people talking in the room. We knocked on the door only to find another couple in the room. They were as surprised as we were. How embarrasing was this. Me and my 76 y/o mother that has had knee replacement had to drag all of our luggage back downstairs to find out what was going on. We were told that they changed our room and didn't let us know. Terrible!!!!! Not sure if I will stay there again. Room still had old time TV's, and furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs New Orleans Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Kathysue51
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay and can not say enough about the hotel and even won some money in the casino, great combination. We were given a suite and was it sweet! The room was so big and complete with everything! We stayed in a corner suite. Room 1112. The employees there have always been the best and friendliest , eager to help you with anything. Of all the Harrahs I have stayed at this is the best ----all around! Love it there!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: daimeow222
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and service. Close to Burbon street. The buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Vegasclint
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that Harrahs operates, if not the best. It is clean with large rooms and great views. The casino is just across the street as is the Convention Center. Bourbon Street is a 10 minute walk as is Cafe DuMonde/Jackson Square area. Plenty of fine restaurants of different types within 5 minutes or less. The staff is great, very friendly, and they keep an eye on who comes and goes, unlike some other downtown hotels. I think it is one of our favorite places, and I highly recommend it. The casino is not the best, but the hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Flower47Nevada
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this hotel for a nurses conference before heading off to a disastrous experience at the JW Marriott (posted review for JW too) - no available nights at Harrah`s on March 29/30th hence the departure. The suite we had was on the 11th floor overlooking the Mississippi river - great view, comfortable bed, great big bathroom and living area. Housekeeping every night. Staff were absolutely wonderful -went the extra mile for us - too many names to mention. Great location and would not hesitate to stay there when we come back to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms - not that clean.”
Reviews.Author: drjds71
Reviews.Content: Check in at this hotel was a nightmare. We got there at 3pm on Sunday and they didn't have any rooms. A lady came around asking how our check in was going and we said they don't have any rooms ready she said she doesn't clean them and disappeared. They said they would call when the rooms were ready. We finally just checked the desk at 5 and they had the rooms we reserved ready. We had a corner suite that smelled of smoke and an adjoining room which was large and was smoke free. The room has an anxiety tube TV that isn't even digital. Something you would expect to see at a Day's Inn. The legs of the tables and if you moved anything in the room it was covered in thick dust -- think enough to write your name in. The bed sheets were soft enough.. pillows were substantial... As with every Casino I have stayed at it's hard to get the room very cold. We put the temp on 60F and it was lucky to be 68 in there. No FAN ON button for constant noise so you hear doors slam all night. The bathroom was large and there was plenty of hot water. If you closed the door in the bathroom there were years of hair and dirt built up behind it. So on the surface this hotel appears very nice... but they don't know how to clean a room correctly. the elevators are fast and efficient. Get a room with a river view.. quite nice to look at during the evening. You must play in casino for a total of 30 minutes to avoid the $30/day self parking fee and you an only go in/out once for free parking. They only validate once every 24 hours no matter how much you play.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: knoxtntraveler_11
Reviews.Content: Love visiting New Orleans! We stayed at Harrah's which is convenient to most everything. Our room faced the riverfront which was so nice. Something going on day and night on the river. We enjoyed watching the cruise ships, barges and all the other traffic on the river. The room was excellent. Great bed, excellent amenities and very clean. We would go out a few hours each morning and our room was always cleaned when we came back. Check in was no problem. Our room wasn't quite ready so we sat in the lobby waiting. Michelle at the front desk kept us informed about wait time and was so very pleasant. I would certainly stay here again. One tip - you can park in the self park garage at no cost if you play in the casino for 2 hours in a 24 hour period. Fun way to earn free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: still_travelling__22
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nicely appointed and clean. Unlike most hotel rooms the two bed option included queen sized beds which made sharing much easier. Our room fronted the river and the barges and cruiseships on the river were fascinating to watch. this hotel is located within walking distance of the convention center, riverfront, streetcar line, D Day museum, the French Quarter, and many, many shops and restaurants. The staff is super friendly and helpful. They did charge us an arm and a leg for a St Patricks night reservation and I think that this was a ripoff. It was probably the same wherever one stayed in the city that night, alas.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip! Would stay even if the trip hadn't been comped!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea K
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great casino - visited the weekend after Mardi Gras - arrived 3 days after and there were still a lot of people there.The hotel is across the street from the casino and even though there is underground tunnel access from the hotel to the casino, it was just a lot more convenient to go out the hotel front door and cross the street to get there. The major parts of our trip were comped by Caesars Entertainment/ Harrahs New Orleans - air, ground transportation from the airport, hotel and a couple of meals at the hotel. We had access to the Diamond Club which was located inside the casino. One of the best parts of the trip! The hostess inside the Diamond Club was friendly, personable and accommodating. Out of the two visits inside for drinks and snacks, only once was there just a 'couch with a coffee table' but a table opened up within 5 minutes and she got us moved over with ease. I can't say enough good things about her - can't recall her name though is started with a C - I'm thinking Corneta?! She is a true asset to Harrahs! They had several snack options which was plenty as it covered all bases. Mini muffalettas, crackers, cheese and fruit, chips and dip, etc. The casino was always full but never had a problem getting on the desired slot machines (which have a beverage service request - it was Awesome!) The drinks were ALWAYS delivered very promptly. As for the hotel, itself, the Staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating! They were tremendous - at times they had short lines but they moved very quickly. The housekeeping staff was always available within minutes as was room service. The ONLY complaint and my friend noticed it not me is that it appeared the floor in the 'commode room,' separate from the shower and main bathroom, hadn't been swept thoroughly. Ruth's Chris is located just outside the lobby and I only ordered a drink from the bar which is separate from the restaurant. Again, the bartender was very prompt and mixed a good strong drink which should be the case since it cost $14 - grey goose and club soda. If the trip hadn't been fully comped, I would still stay there - again, their entire staff was so very prompt, accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “mix up'd rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: Booked and pre-paid for 2 King rooms w/river views. At check-in, we are told they have no King rooms available. Told us we could stay in the double rooms for all 3 nights or we could stay one night in the double room and then "possibly" move to a king if they have one open up. I pre-booked and pre-paid. I should have gotten what I was promised. The double room with NO river view was ok. Room was spacious and clean. Room service was 'ok'. I would have rated this higher if I didn't feel like we got ripped off a little. I should have gotten what I paid for and pre-booked. I really don't think I would stay here again. I would try a different hotel and see if I could get my King bed that I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Trish W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Harrahs New Orleans 3 times now. It is a very nice hotel with friendly staff. The rooms are a nice size and clean. It is a good location to be able to walk to the French Quarter area and also waterfront/convention center area. We are Harrahs Diamond members so get these rooms for free....but always manage to pay for them at the casino! My only service issue was the last night I had been given a late check-out 1pm. The housekeeper came knocking on my door at 11:15am...ugh! This happens at so many hotels...why bother giving a late check-out and then not inform your cleaning staff! other than that is was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Lisa V
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally hospitable. Friendly and inviting from the moment we entered the property. The hotel room had wonderful decor and layout. The bathroom was very clean and large. With it's location is within walking distance to many attractions - the riverwalk, french market & french quarter, there is no need to have a car. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlang11
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. Great service - very friendly happy staff. As other reviewers said - ask for 15th floor and above facing the river. We were on the 20th floor and had a room facing the city. The view was limited as we were facing another hotel. We had a king size bed that was very comfortable. There was little to no street noise as we were on the 20th floor. Our room was a good size and had a safe and refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Manon M
Reviews.Content: We went on a date, my sig other promising a mind-blowing experience. He was right! Although I was intimidated a bit by all the sexy women in the Masquerade Club, I think I held my own. If you want a place to start the night, and then hit the French Quarter, and then end the night, this is the place! I have no idea how much it cost, so I cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joe c
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel & located in a very good place. The rooms are excellent & the property is well maintained & managed. Easy parking & next to the Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference at this hotel. It is within walking distance to the French Quarter and right near the Riverfront. It is connected to the Casino, of course, and the Casino is nice. The lobby is not huge, but the staff is friendly. I had reserved a king room. I was told on checking in that they did not have any more king rooms. I was told I had no choice but to take 2 queens as there were no upgrades available. At least they gave me a higher floor facing the river. The room was nice. The TV, fridge and safe are well hidden in a closet like area facing the bed. Next to it is the actual cost. The room stayed cool and you could hear very little noise. Housekeeping did a good job. The bed was very comfortable. The only downside is there is no desk at all. Bathroom was large with a stand up shower and a nice tub as well. Plenty of places to eat. Either walk to the French Quarter, of course, or there is plenty right there either in the Casino or near the casino. Mother's is just a block away, too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Christopher P
Reviews.Content: Staff was terrible to deal with. There are much better hotels in the area with a nicer staff than Harrah's that are more affordable! Hands down the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at in New Orleans. Do your homework and you can find much better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: artap
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and lovely staff! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: yadkinvalleycouple
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and have never been disappointed. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and very nice. The location is great. It's a easy walk downtown and to the French Quarter. The streetcar line is also close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: lisadd_10
Reviews.Content: Off of Fulton Street, I was very impressed with the Harrah's Hotel. The staff was very courteous and friendly ... they greeted you each and every time you walked through the lobby, inquiring about your stay and asking if there was anything they could do for you. I was pleasantly surprised with a Praline on my pillow the first night. It was the first time I had one, and wow ... I was hooked. The room was very clean and the hotel is in walking distance of all the great spots you need to see in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Stay in the heart of New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: shornilla
Reviews.Content: I checked in over the holidays in December. I had five nights at the hotel property afforded to me complimentary on behalf of Harrah's. I am a Diamond member of the Total Rewards program. Reservation was made the month prior to my stay over the winter holidays. I arrived at the hotel property shortly before noon and was notified by the front desk attendant that I would not be able to check-in early. With that notice I took the liberty of utilizing self-parking. There is a charge for the Harrah's parking garage, but I was pleasantly surprised that I had my parking fees waived as another privilege of being a Diamond Total Rewards member. The parking garage is connected to the hotel property and offers an underground connection the the Harrah's Casino across the street. Check-In As it was the winter holiday season the lobby was bustling with pedestrian traffic of all types ranging from families to couples of all ages and types. I approached the front desk counter where my reservation of five complimentary nights was confirmed. Since I do not prefer to leave a credit card on file, I was allowed to place a cash deposit on the hotel room ($100 per night of stay required). I was placed in room 1505 that offered a very scenic view of the Mississippi River. Total check-in time was less than eight (8) minutes. The Room The assigned room for my reservation was on the 15th floor of the hotel property. Upon entering the hotel room it was surprisingly spacious and well-kept compared to other Harrah's properties that I have stayed at. The bathroom is spacious, offering a separate shower and bath tub as well as large vanity area and separate toilet area. The closet and entertainment center were cleverly designed into the wall to permit a more open floor plan. The king-size bed as well as other linens in the room exhibited a purple color scheme that is distinctive of many Harrah's properties. The Stay The room was well-kept throughout our stay during the week. The best part about this property is the proximity to many of the attractions in the area and nearby French Quarter. You did have to utilize your room key as evidence of stay, which I found to be a great security measure especially during the holiday season. Also, the hotel rooms utilize an electronic notification system that allows you to digitally label the room as occupied, requiring housekeeping service or simply "Do Not Disturb". I did enjoy the turn down service provided to my hotel room after arriving each day of busy excursions throughout the city. I did eat at the Gordon Biersch restaurant located on property, which offered great classic American food. The garlic fries were especially delicious. I also ate at the Grand Isle Fresh Seafood Restaurant located adjacent to the hotel property, which is a fantastic restaurant serving great local cuisine. Both meals were pricey, but complimentary on behalf of Harrah's and their restaurant partner locations throughout the city. The hotel does offer a business center located among their conference rooms, but internet access does cost extra. Check-Out The check-out process was quick. I was furnished my cash deposit immediately upon check-out and the process took less than two minutes. Overall Experience I thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary stay at this Harrah's property and was a great way to experience New Orleans at little cost to me. The partnerships with this hotel made using my Total Rewards points even more lucrative with such a vast array of choices throughout the city. I would highly recommend this stay if you want to remain in the heart of New Orleans and savor the local culture and flare.

Reviews.Title: “Do...Not...Stay...Here!”
Reviews.Author: elkayandboro
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed here for 1 night recently. We reserved a king, smoking room. I called twice during the day to reconfirm our reservation. We were assured that our room would be available as requested regardless of our arrival time. When we arrived late in the evening, we were told that there were no king OR smoking rooms available. I protested, and spoke to the front desk manager. He checked the computer and actually told us that because we were only 'gold' Total Rewards members, there was nothing he could do for us. So basically, because we don't gamble alot in their casino, we were second class citizens. As we were tired, and there was no other availabe rooms nearby, we stayed there reluctantly. Also, without notice, they put a hold on our bank account for more than double the room rate. I was told it would be a week or so before that charge is refunded. This place has a very inflated view of itself. The rooms are OK, about like a Holiday Inn. Absolutely nothing special for the exhorbitant prices. Bottom line, we, or no one I know, will ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays at Harrah's New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: EZMARK
Reviews.Content: Traveled in December the week after Christmas and stayed 4 days. WHAT A JOY these folks are! Hospitality and concern for your having a fun time was not just from the Concierge but from everyone from Housekeepers to Hotel Management staff Check in was quick and courteous and Bell service awesome Room was very nice and roomy with that special Harrah's touch of correct color coordination and style. Bathroom large with separate glass shower and tub was a nice touch. (LOTS AND LOTS of hot water was a good thing too) Room location was a little low for my tastes (6th floor) and definitely too close to the Harrah's parking garage. Did not spend a lot of time in the room BUT if I had that would have been annoying. (CAR ALARMS!!) Lobby area of the hotel and onsite Steak House very nice. There is a covered area that connects the hotel to the casino underground system and it is well lit and maintained at all times. Casino is across the street BUT it is connected via underground tunnel so even if the weather is bad NO ISSUES getting to the Casino Casino was very well maintained and the staff on EVERY level there was exactly like the hotel. Courteous, prompt and knowledgeable (Found myself challenged by the drink ordering system that is embedded into the machines BUT a lovely Cocktail waitress helped me figure it out) Great selection of slots and did not get rich but did not lose a lot either. VERY even play to win ratio for the most part. Ate in every restaurant that was in the casino area and all were very good and the staff once again hospitable. Buffet was very good and a great selection of Southern style cooking with a complimentary glass of wine served at your table. Gift shop was small and did not have ANY of Harrah's swag (shirts, jackets etc) that actually said Harrah's New Orleans on them. A little disappointed in that but otherwise good. Within walking distance of Canal and Bourbon streets and everyone is helpful in getting you to where you are going. AS a Diamond member I have been treated well in several different Harrah's locations gtom Vegas to Chicago but NEVER made to feel like I was the king of the Hotel as I was here in New Orleans. Highly recommend for the food, fun and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: SaraFrankino
Reviews.Content: Rooms were so nice! Beds are so comfortable. Great location. Close by the water, casino, great restaurants, and close to Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Very curteous staff”
Reviews.Author: FINMAN
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for the first time. The Hotel itself was clean and well maintained. The room was nothing special but was also clean and well maintained. The staff was very curteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: lance982
Reviews.Content: The hotel part of this Harrah's is not connected to the actual Casino..so be prepared to walk just a small ways..The casino itself was a lot of fun with a good variety of slot machines from many denominations as well(for the really high roller I saw a $500 2 line game..ps Not me)..Couple of food places to eat along with a buffet..nothing to really blow my socks away..Buffet was ok..the deli place wasn't really very good(I'm a northerner so maybe it was the southern spin on things)..There is a Fudrucker as well however we didn't eat there..on the plus side of food and beverage there was a Starbucks..Of course it would have got a 5 star if we had won money..we did lose over 2 days but it seemed fair and did let us win some pretty good payouts on relatively small bets..Also improve eating options at the actual casino would be good as well..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: deeloef
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel through a conference he was attending and we stayed 6 nights. We received a king room and I was amazed at how large it was, one of the best designed rooms we've seen. In addition to the large comfortable bed, there was a couch, easy chair and desk. Tucked inside a built-in storage were the tv, mini-fridge, safe and closet, all cleverly hidden behind doors. The bathroom was enormous with a large tub and separate shower. Each of the staff we encountered was professional and friendly, especially the doormen and valets. The French Quarter and river front areas are both within easy walking distance...we never needed a cab. You can also catch the trolley just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably fine!”
Reviews.Author: judgejohnny
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff just take you to heart and cuddle you. Can't walk through the lobby without being asked "how can we help you". The rooms are tastefully and exquisitely furnished. It is so nice that the hotel is maintained separately and across the street from Harrah's Casino. Great location, being near shopping at the Riversside Mall, better shops on Canal, trolleys close by, and near to French Quarter. We were comped in by Harrah's, and that had to be one of the best bargains we've ever experienced. Great views from higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honeydew78
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Harrahs in New Orleans. The personnel at the hotel were all very friendly and ready to help you in any way. Room was a corner suite with an awesome view of the river. Loved watching all the river traffic going by! Room was equipped with everything you would need...refrigerator, hair dryer, etc. Beds were really comfy and the room was very clean. I am a diamond player so my parking slip was validated for the entire stay by the hotel personnel, otherwise you need to validate it at a kiosk in the casino after 30 minutes of play. I had luck playing video poker but found all the other slots TIGHT! Had a great meal at Besh's steakhouse. Other great meals were at Commander's Palace, La Bayou on Bourbon St., Cafe du monde for beignets and we always eat at Mother's. Also tried Red Gravy for breakfast. It was so-so.. My only complaint was that they don't comp you for any meals..even after winning jackpots!! Had to take them off my players card. Overall a great trip and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: yankee79
Reviews.Content: I was in town for the Sugar Bowl this year and originally had reservations across the river but changed to this hotel because it was at the casino. Super nice hotel with large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LonaWarren
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at Harrah's New Orleans. The room was fantastic and the staff was simply excellent. They were extremely friendly and helpful! We had a great time, and we contributed heavily to the New Orleans economy while we were there. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, big room”
Reviews.Author: Melissa1213
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrah's on our final night in New Orleans, and we enjoyed our stay. Our room was very large and had a nice view of the river, the bathroom had a separate tub and shower, and the room was clean and comfortable. Since we were only there for one night we didn't utilize many of the services or amenities offerred at the hotel, but I recommend it to anyone who wants to stay within walking distance to the French Quarter. PS - The hotel and surrounding area was beautifully decorated for Christmas too - it was a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Has It All”
Reviews.Author: GAYLACP
Reviews.Content: We were there during the week of the Big 3--Sugar Bowl, NFL playoffs and BCS, but Harrah's level of service didn't suffer a bit. Upon returning to the hotel each time, we were greeted by friendly staff, and our room was always promptly made up each day. The location is out of the French Quarter which is nice when you're ready to settle down for some quiet time in the oh-so-comfortable bed, but you're near enough to any activity you could possibly want. A great place to say. Oh, and, there's a casino attached!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasTexaspride
Reviews.Content: The staff are some of the best! Friendly and quick-very professional staff. The rooms are very clean and nice. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jasper298
Reviews.Content: My stay here was outstanding. The hotel is very nice, with accomodations comparable to the best hotels in the area. It is much better than the Hilton Riverside and the staff treats you like royalty. They are very helpful and the rooms are spacious. In addition, there is underground connection to the casino. Could not be better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for one evening. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. We had a neat view of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great - Casino Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Douglas L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel as a gust of Harrah's. The personnel at the hotel were all great. The room was clean and the service excellent. On the other hand - the casino's slots wouldn't always read your players card, wouldn't always give you back a receipt. The service of one of the lady's at the 'players club' who reissued our cards was downright poor - she acted as if we interrupted her time. We went back the next day and the lady who then waited on us was very courteous, friendly and pleasent. She corrected what the previous lady didn't do with the reissue of our cards. B. C. Lecomte

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imacroy
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading some older negative reviews. From the bellman that open my car door to the last person to close the car door, the stay was perfect. The workers were very nice, friendly, helpful and went out of their way to answer any questions. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was very nice, huge tub with seperate shower and toilet room (water closet). The king size bed maybe short for anyone 6"4' or over. I did not eat in the hotel or associated restraunts, New Orleans just too many places to eat and living only an hour away we eat in New Orleans often. We walked where we went, even to the French Quarter. The managers at Harrahs must have read the reviews because we did not have problems that others mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: gumbogirlie
Reviews.Content: I'm a Harrah's diamond level player and have been coming to this hotel since it opened. Excellence in service has never wavered, even before I had a players card.
