The casino is not always good to me, but this wonderful hotel and their staff are. My most recent stay was four days and I always look forward to our December visit to see the beautiful gingerbread creation and decorations in the lobby. I shopped in the very close Riverwalk Mall, had fine meals at Besh Steak, great beer at Gordon Biersch and a visit to the buffet. Looking forward to the new Archie Manning Sports Bar opening soon that will only be a few steps away from the hotel. It always amazes me that even in passing, all the service personnel smile and greet you warmly. I've ordered room service many times and it is always quick and well presented. Another thing I love is, this hotel is one of the quietest I have ever stayed in. You will never hear the people in the next room. If you are a gambler, I highly recommend getting a Harrah's card. It takes very little use to get great hotel and meal offers coming in the mail. On another note, Christmas in New Orleans is a great time to visit a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Harah's & New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BocceKing
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is a great place to stay in New Orleans. It is so convenient to all the attractions and things to do. The Quarter of course, the River, the trolleys to travel all over the city cheaply, the Ferry, etc.. The hotel itself is very nice and everyone is so friendly and polite. The whole city is like that. The rooms are a step above most other casino hotels, unless you are high rollers, which we are not. Be a little careful around Jackson Square at night, but during the day, very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: headraccoon
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this property. I've stayed at lots of Harrahs (now Ceasars) hotels. The employees were so friendly and helpful. I'm talking from the doorman, the bell man and the checkin clerks. We just couldn't believe how great everything was. We had a very nice room on the 8th floor overlooking the river. Easy access to the casino and French Quarter. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place”
Reviews.Author: Krystle C
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I stood her for two night while in new orleans for mardi gras 2011. Harrah's was amazing the rooms are so clean & nice, lovely white robes for you to wear. Restrooms were so big, n the huge tube was awesome. Room service was fast n the steak house food down stairs was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: TigerX369
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the top rated tripadvisor critiques for this hotel, I decided to book two nights. Honestly, I was very disappointed with the fact that nothing I was promised was fulfilled. They herd customers in and out of this hotel like sheep rudely! At the front desk, all they do is order to do things to each other without showing any consideration to customers. You are NOBODY unless you gamble at their casino! I booked a room with a King size bed and ended up with two beds for my romantic weekend getaway with my friend. When I was booking at the web site, I was given a choice of a room with the different type of beds. I also called to ensure that I would get a King size bed. The person I talked to said â€œno problemâ€�. Also the beds were very uncomfortable. The picture of the room on the internet was nothing like the room we stayed in. I was told that I could have a late check out on Sunday at 14:00 hours on the phone. On Sunday, when I asked they did not let us stay beyond 11:30. Very VERY poor customer service at the front desk! First night, our room was prepared for the night. Second night, no service! The phones in the room were nasty and did not work properly. Very RUDE! I will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: Cyberpup45
Reviews.Content: I was attending a convention and Harrah's wasn't one of the "convention hotels". I stayed there anyway and I'm glad I did. The location is perfect. Close to the convention center, the Riverwalk Mall, and the French Quarter. The staff was outstanding. So many of them anticipated that I needed help or information before I even asked. My room was really nice with a great view of the Mississippi. The casino was fun with a good variety of slots. We ate at Ruth Chris two nights with great food and great service. Drago's at the Hilton was very good, too. I hadn't been in NOLA since the late 1990's but now I hope to be back early next year.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Craigsworld
Reviews.Content: New Orleans tourism must be doing better. Most of the hotels were charging high rates in early December. By far the most affordable room rate was at Harrah's, located across the street from the casino of the same name. While I find the casino a bit drab and depressing, the hotel was bright, tasteful, and fresh. Service personnel were very friendly and the rooms were good size and comfortable. My only gripe is the parking which was over $30 for self-parking. Discounts are available if you gamble. I'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Harrahs yet”
Reviews.Author: winwinwin333
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Harrahs in five different cities now but this is by far the nicest one and the best managed. Service is as good as it gets. Pleasant, helpful, friendly staff from A thru Z. Just a few blocks off Decatur Street and beginning of French Quarter. Great location with a big casino (also Harrahs) right across the street. Friendly concierge staff quickly lined up our tours (city, cemetery, plantations, WW II Museum, swamps). Valet parking ($34 night) isn't cheap but it's same at all other hotels. Overall, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with super staff”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: When I travel, I usually tend to stay at chain properties. On this business trip, I decided to stay at Harrah's due to its location close to the convention center and French Quarter and the fact of its ranking on this site. After reviewing other hotels in the area and noting them to be dated and hearing about the hotels other convention-goers were staying in (many are converted, older buildings with very small rooms) I believe this was an excellent choice! Rooms are very spacious, beds comfortable, and the dual tub and glass-enclosed shower is a plus. I appreciated the electronic safe in the room and flat screen TV. Everything was clean and fresh. I was never bothered by housekeeping. Room service is available all day and was served quickly. Not a large room-service menu by any means, but very adequate. The location is perfect. Quick walk to the casino, restaurants, convention center, and Bourbon Street. I felt very safe staying here since there is lots of traffic outside this hotel at all times of the day due to its proximety to the convention center. The one thing that sets this hotel apart is the staff. EVERYONE was friendly and truly delivered the Harrah's A+ service. I always felt that my presence at the hotel was appreciated by the staff. I did not encounter a single issue during my stay. I would not hesitate booking this hotel no matter your reason for traveling to New Orleans and is an excellent base for those attending conventions at the convention center. Thanks Harrah's for demonstrating that great service and hospitality is not a thing of the past!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, wonderful rooms, service was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Cricket1964
Reviews.Content: Moved to this hotel in the middle of our stay and LOVED it! Right on the Riverwalk, walking distance to many attractions and streetcar line. Well appointed rooms, super-comfy beds, clean, clean rooms. Service was wonderful, I mean WONderful!! Would definitely stay here for next trip to New Orleans, and we don't even go across the street into the casino, lol!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: anne h
Reviews.Content: We went with part of our family over Thanksgiving weekend. From the moment we pulled into the hotel till the time we pulled out, our experience with the Harrah's employees was lovely. They were all welcoming and engaging. I don't know how their empolyees are trained, but to us, it seemed like a warmth that has been spread throughout the hotel. Our rooms were large, clean, and very comfortable. The sheets were a nice quality, and for once, did not come away from the bed, and stayed tucked. The seperate shower had lots of room, good hot water, and nice pressure. We did not use any of the hotel's facilities, except for a drink in the bar at Ruth Chris', which was reasonable and good quality. The hotel was completely sold out during our visit, but that did not effect the employees, who wanted to make sure you were enjoying your time at Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: leole
Reviews.Content: Great room food good casino ok.Clean and very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloLake
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there in the past and the hotel never disappoints me. The staff are very helpflu and friendly. The hotel is very clean and the location is great. Costs a few more dollars but is well worth it. Would recommend -

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie D
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd visit to stay 3 nights before cruising from New Orleans. Great location to tour from and great selection of wonderful restaurants. The rooms are nice, clean and the beds are comfy. Stunning views, beautiful bathrooms. Positive on transportation is the trolly $1.25 pp to many destinations is located very close to Harrahs. Negative is how much cab fare is, ex: $33 for 2 from the airpport and to go just a few blocks to the cruise terminal was $42 and returning in the cab to Harrahs (5 min ride) $25. If you visit, do not miss, Besh Steak House and Gordon Biersch, they are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “One night; not enough”
Reviews.Author: garypcsc
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our one night stay at Harrah's New Orleans. This hotel doesn't need a casino to make it a destination. It is reasonably close to the river as well as Bourbon Street and other attractions in New Orleans. We arrived fairly early on a Sunday morning just returning from a cruise. Absolutely no problem checking in with good instructions on how to access the parking lot (we normally use Valet, but had too much stuff in the car to put it all away). Parking was free with validation of 30 minutes of slot machine play or a longer period on a table game. I believe that the free parking applied to either the valet or self park. Our room which was on 19th floor had an excellent view of the city. It was extremely spacious (could be that our balcony cabin on the ship had something to do with our perception of the size of the room), but sincerely it was the largest of 4 rooms we stayed in on this particular trip. Not only large, but very classy in decor and furnishings with a king size bed, sofa, arm chair, ottoman coffee table and desk with chair.. The bathroom was very large with tile walls and floor with seperate tub, shower and toilet. There was plenty of room for incidentals on the commode. The room was also equipped with a mini- refrigerator, coffee maker and wireless internet (although all Harrah's hotels charge for this service; $12,00 in this case). The room was spotlessly clean and everything was in good repair. We were also very pleased with a top sheet covering the blanket. There are a number of restaurants easily accessible from this hotel, two of which are Ruth's Chris Steak House and Besh Steak along with a buffet in the casino plus others whose names escape me at this point. Needless to say, in my opinion. you cannot go wrong staying at Harrah's New Orleans and if the room is comped...more better!

Reviews.Title: “Great reception, good rooms, but a really awful casino...and the food was sh1t”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: This place tries hard and succeeds as good accommodation. The rest of the place is frucking awful. Bar staff don't know what a sazerac is, the always on smoking policy is great for lung cancer sufferers who have bought into it, but for the rest of us folks who dont want to breathe your trucking exhaust fumes, it's a big no no. Hotel is ok, but no bar and sh1te food. Casino is tattoed White trash going large. Stay somewhere authentic and have great times. You won't have them here.

Reviews.Title: “make sure you clean before using”
Reviews.Author: eyaknod
Reviews.Content: While I know one should probally always clean an exercise machine before using, I have always felt that one way to measure a hotel's comittment to protecting your health when travelling is to see how they maintain the exercise room. On first glance Harrah's looks ok BUT I discovered there was absolutely nothing - no wipes, no spray bottles - nothing but a dry towel to wipe down the equipment. I spoke to the hotel Manager, Mr McLaughlin (my spelling), when other employees saw nothing wrong with this, and he shared their attitiude - seemed amused that anyone would not be satisfied with one of the employees coming in once an hour (note none were there when I was in there and I was exercising for over 90 minutes). Hope they are better at sanitizing the room I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a view.”
Reviews.Author: edarh
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Nice room with a very comfortable bed. Received a discounted rate with last minute travel. Room was not as clean as it should have been, I had to wipe food from the coffee table.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard to beat anywhere in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: hopeFairhopeAL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and continue to be amazed at the wonderful welcoming staff members and check in staff. Who ever hires and trains them is the best . We have been lucky to travel all over the US, Carribean, Italy, Spain etc and have never received such consistently professional courteous treatment anywhere. They truly make you feel welcomed 99.9% of the time. There is such a happy feeling in the lobby with the great NO music always playing. The rooms are very well appointed. The housekeeping staff is very polite and extremely quiet. It is in a great location in the warehouse district across from the casino, 2 blocks from the riverfront and one block from Canal so that you simply cross Canal and you are in the French Quarter. If you want to take cab down into the quarter rather than walking (The quarter is up to 14 blocks long on the far end) the cost is under $10 plus tip. Walking is preferred when weather is good because there is so much to see, hear, smell....It is cleaner, prettier and so back and so better than pre-Katrina yet it still has the authentic feeling it always had. We go every other week end. Another note: Ruth Chris Steak House is the one site restaurant and bar with a lovely outside patio for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: galivantstom
Reviews.Content: Just after Labor Dayl, while on a vaction trip, we stayed at Harrah's New Orleans. The view of the river was outstanding, the room was plush, and sparkling clean. It was clear attention was part and parcel of the hotel experience provided. Being just a couple of blocks from the French Quarter was another huge plus. It allowed us to walk from the hotel and enjoy walking the entire French Quarter. The few times I needed staff service, on the casino floor and in parking, it was quickly and cheerfully provided. In short, this is a first class hotel. If you're going to New Orleans, check it out! I'll be going back to New Orleans in a few months and there's doubt where I'll be staying. .

Reviews.Title: “So Friendly...”
Reviews.Author: smiley2269
Reviews.Content: As a diamond member, I was pleased to see the reward program provide me a great offer. We landed at 8am and left our luggage to walk around but after 10 mintues, my phone rang and our room was ready. Accomodations were great, beds comfortable, room clean, safe, fridge all that you ask for. We did have an issue with our toilet but the staff was responsive and the issue was resolved immediately. Great location, close to Red Gravy for breakfast or lunch my favorite place. The trolly was nearby and only about 6-8 blocks walking to the french quarter. If you want to get the excitment of the quarter but comfort of leaving it behind, Harrahs is a great place. The casion, we had some luck but as us gamablers do, we gave it back. The staff everywhere you went were the friendliest people I have met. Casino buffet was ok, fried chicken was to die for. I didn't make it to the diamond lounge but understand there is one. Lots of people recommended the steak house Chef Besh but we didn't make that either. Went to free jazz concert on Wed at local park....just great trip...great city but be aware it can be dirty, stinky and for two females we were smart and safe so please keep that in mind!!!

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE WITH A SMILE”
Reviews.Author: Cyrique
Reviews.Content: I visited New Orleans for the first time with my Sister In Law, Louise Austrie whom I'd not seen in 38 years!!! We stayed at Harrah's Hotel in New Orleans. We were greeted with a glass of Champagne and from that day, it was service with a smile. The room was delightful and the food was absolutely brilliant. We participated in the festival and were on a float, organised by the hotel and threw beads to onlookers. They fed us like my Mum would and really catered to our every need. Any complaint is taken very seriously. You are treated as a very valued customer. I would certainly stay there again. The People of New Orleans are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: GrayGhostVirginia
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and efficient. The rooms are clean and very elegant. If you have a TR card, the prices can be very reasonable ( we were comped for 2 of 3 nights.) As far as the casino, we did ok on Tues. and Wed. On Thursday it seemed like someone through a switch and the machines got very, very tight. Could just be me though. Located next to the French Quarter. Access to street cars very close by. When we were there an all day bus/streetcar pass was only $3 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: garrettrahan
Reviews.Content: I stay here about 3X a year and love this place. The room, service, and SUPER friendly staff makes this a very pleasurable experience. The good thing about this hotel is that is is next to the docks and river with the many shops and restaurants and just a short walk to the quarter. Of course the casino is right next to the hotel but even if you do not gamble, the 5 star service is worth it all.

Reviews.Title: “INTRIGUING INTERIOR TO EXCELLENT CASINO”
Reviews.Author: hooglesnorpus
Reviews.Content: The Harrahs Hotel was full, so I was comped a room at the Loews Hotel across the street just maybe 150' away door to door. Loews was an excelelnt hotel with the best damn pink lemonade I ever had at their front desk. But I digress. Back to the Harrahs Casino. From the time I walked in I saw elaborate statues and designs reflecting the Mardi Gras theme that was there. One was even a REAL FLOAT used in the Mardi Gras parade. Took lots of pics. The casino was well laid out with signs indicating which doors to exit to get to which streets. They had all the requisite games including my favorites Baccarrat and Pai Gow Poker. This was during the week so table limits were like $15 which was nice. The buffet there was very good and well priced. Lunch was about $10 on a weekday. I left there about even, so my winnings or losses do not reflect in this review. NOTE: Always park in the Harrahs garage and if it is full go valet at the Casino. "other" parking will cost over $40 a day!! I found this out the hardway. Bourbon street is a safe 4 block walk from Harrahs Casino. Harrahs Could Have made their location a scalped down clip version that many do that have a 100% hold of the local casino market, but they DID NOT and went upscale and fair.

Reviews.Title: “Good table action, great service”
Reviews.Author: Sjayflo
Reviews.Content: Great place to hit the gambling tables. Wait staff is on point and overall experience was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: utelein
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location within walking distance to the French Quarter. Super friendly staff, helpfull and available to help where needed. Clean room, large comfortable bath. Ask for high floor with view, it's worth it. A short walk to the mighty Mississippi. Great hotel if you are getting on a cruise ship from New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karlyforet
Reviews.Content: Free room with comps from the casino. But this hotel is fabolous in every way possible. Bathrooms with marble floors, huge tubs in regular rooms. Would stay here again for free or paying! Perfect location too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about the hotel. We can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: barbarapitts
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we were upgrade to a wonderful suite. It was very large and the view was great. The hotel is new and very clean. The staff was outstanding. Very friendly and helpful. The location was great There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel. We just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: nvky
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at Harrah's New Orleans! Loved waking up to the views of the Mississippi River. Bed was comfortable and also enjoyed having a fridge in the room for water and sodas. Housekeeping did a great job daily of cleaning and replenishing towels, shampoos, etc... Short walk to Bourbon Street and French Market - or you can catch the Trolley right out in front of the Casino if you prefer not to walk as much. All Lobby staff goes above and beyond to help you with what ever you may need or want. (Seven Stars Staff is also Outstanding) Only negative: Too many Good restaurants in the area to choose from and trip not long enough to try them all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FortunateSun
Reviews.Content: We have have stayed at Harrah's - New Orleans twice, and both visits were very pleasant. All of the hotel employees are very friendly and accomodating. Rooms are fairly spacious and have exceptionally comfortable beds. There are electronic switches by the door to indicate "Do not disturb" and to request housekeeping, which is a nice convenience. We ordered steaks via room service (during both visits), and they arrived hot and perfectly cooked to order. The hotel is a short walk from the Riverfront shops/restaurants/aquarium and is within walking distance (~ 1/2 mile) from Bourbon Street. The only shortcoming I've noticed is that the hotel room doors are poorly insulated from hallway sounds. This is not a problem, unless you share the same floor with loud, inconsiderate people. If you are a light sleeper, I recommend requesting a room away from the elevators. The overall hotel accomodations are excellent, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: florida70
Reviews.Content: I LOVED visiting this hotel, and I will definitely return! It is located w/n walking distance to the French Quarter. FYI...if you valet and need your car, then you will pay $40 each time. That's not worth the money. Park in the attached garage and spend a little time in the casino, then the casino will validate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MrBo70809
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel stay at http://neworleans.com (even saved $30). Hotel is great. Quick walk to the French Quarter. Ruth Chris in the lobby was amazing. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NLTraveller52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's August 2011 and it far exceeded our expectations. From the beautiful lobby to the wonderful room. The room was spacious, the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was very large with a huge tub and separate shower. The toilet was in a separate room. We had an amazing view of the Riverwalk and the Mighty Mississippi River. The location was great, close to the French Quarter. The casino was nice, clean and had a great variety of slots and connected to the hotel by an underground walkway. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrays for a couple of days a couple of weeks ago, great location, within walking distance to the French Quarter and other "attractions". Hotel is very nice, as is the casino. Very friendly staffs at both places. The hotel is across the street from the casino but if you don't want to cross the street, especially if you've had a few drinks, lol, there is a tunnel you can take to get back and forth between the two. You can get your parking ticket validated after playing in the casino for 30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Great Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: danber49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrahs in October of 2010 , and absolutely loved it, Very close to The French Quarter. New Orleans what a great place to visit , the people are so friendly and the food is amazing. We enjoyed it so much we are returning to Harrahs again in November of this year. We are so excited ...can't wait Debbie Anber

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KRoman4
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the hotel is A plus. The beds are comfortable. The bathroom is large with a huge tub and a separate shower. Everything was clean. The room was quiet. Our view was fantastic. If you by-pass the valet parking and self-park, you can have your parking validated after 30 minutes of casino play. We ate at the buffet and enjoyed the variety. We also dined at Besh Steaks and were very happy with our food and drink. The only negative is that the hotel doesn't have a pool. Tip - if you don't want to wait in the long lines at the Cafe du Monde for your coffee and begneits, try the stand in the Riverwalk.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND OUTSTANDING ATTENTION TO DETAIL”
Reviews.Author: Christopher N
Reviews.Content: If you want it Harrah's makes it happen. the room was stunning and the bathroom was a room in itself. By far top quality and will come back to stay again! Kudos to the staff, housekeeping, valet, and room service - just outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: T0mmy2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in January 2011, the hotel is in a good location only a short walk from Bourban Street and the water front. The hotel is a good standard, modern with the usual ammenities you would expect from a hotel of this standard. The room was of a decent size with a king size bed, flat screen TV, in room safe and fast wifi. The hotel has a gym however I did not get to try this. The hotel is linked directly to the Harrahs casino via a tunnel, which is a good size casino with the usual selection of table games and slots, although table games were a $10 min when I was there so not a cheap night (unless you are lucky). The casino has the usual Starbucks and a buffet, whilst the hotel also has a selection of other restaurants, including a micro brewery pub with a good selection of beer. Bourban street is a short walk away through an area that seemed ok (during the day at least) or a very short cab ride. All in all, I would say this hotel is of a good standard, with good ammenities in a good area for the tourist. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Southerngal112
Reviews.Content: Spent a birthday weekend in New Orleans and stayed at Harrah's. This was our first time at this property, but it won't be the last. Wonderful personnel working the front desk and around the lobby. Rooms very spacious and clean. Wonderful location. Super restaurants right outside the hotel. Had a great time. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelsNW
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, and QUIET for sure. The staff here is VERY wonderful and helpful. This will be the only place I stay at in NOLA, and we walked to most everywhere from here - the entire french quarter and easy to find. Thanks Harrahs!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Buc40
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on 24th floor river view, which was given to me at checkin, without asking. The girls working the desk are super friendly and want to make your stay pleasant. Room was clean,beds very nice and service a plus. They call after you get to your room to make sure your happy and greet you eveyday as you go out and come back in. You will feel wanted here. Now my value was good, as room was free. But they could have given me a cheaper room or charged me for view, which they didn't. TIP-Park yourself at the casino next door. When you gamble with your rewards card for 30 minutes, you will get free parking for 24 hours. Saves you $30 a day. If you want to eat nearby,Grand Isle-great fresh fish and salad and Mulates for cajun food and music at 7pm.Walk to both.Buffet at casino is okay,if discounted or you have free coupon.Otherwise you can find better in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Next best thing to being the King”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper409
Reviews.Content: Park in the Harrah's garage and get your ticket validated either in the casino for a minimum number of plays or in the hotel at the desk. Go to Mulates [a block down the street] and enjoy the seafood and music. Go to Moskas and enjoy the Italian food. Go to the French Quarters and enjoy the Kerry Irish Pub. Go to the casino and win some $$$$--be the only one who smiles when you leave. This is a great hotel. Everyone is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KhemQueen
Reviews.Content: Front Desk customer service was very welcoming..room very spacious...casino personel very accommodating...overall the trip was GREAT

Reviews.Title: “BEST GAMING IN THE SOUTH”
Reviews.Author: rnphatpat
Reviews.Content: Went down to New Orleans this past July ,stayed at Harrah"s New Orleans. Beautiful hotel excellent service. I find the buffetts a bit pricey. Next time you are in the city take your GPS system with you, as you will find lots of great chain resturants for half the price of the hotel"s pricey fair, for example we found an I HOP about 6 blocks from the hotel using the pedestrian mode on the GPS. It cost less than $20.00 for 2 adults.We found several great inexpensive places to eat and saved our budget for the gaming. Will be back real soon!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: leo21
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. We ended up in premium room on a high floor. The room was comfy with a spacious bathroom. Loved the walk in shower and view of the river. Everyone was friendly and the location was top notch. We could walk to almost anything. We are already planning our trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Annual Birthday Trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: We took our annual birthday trip to New Orleans and as alaways, since they opened their doors, we stayed at Harrah's. We had another great trip, the associates were as friendly as ever, the room perfect as usual and the food was great! You can't go wrong with Harrah's. Thanks Harrah's for another great birthday. See you guys soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Timeisatrain
Reviews.Content: Review Harrahs Hotel New Orleans My wife and I recently had a pleasant stay at Harrahâ€™s hotel. Beautiful, specious room; clean, well equipped bathroom, the type you immediately start taking pictures of. The location might be just a bit of the centre spot of things, though we never minded the short walk to the French quarter. Itâ€™s not far from the Riverwalk mall, which is handy, thereâ€™s a trolley station. No noise issues encountered during our stay, which is something we value very high, after good clean sanitary amenities. There is wifi throughout the hotel, a little bit of a hassle is the fact that you have to go get a new password daily. We felt right at home walking in here, nothing negative to mention at all.

Reviews.Title: “I Love New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: leebloome
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to this trip for years, and this Harrah's property is lovely. But overall I was disappointed in the fact that I had notified VIP services, and everyone else I could talk to, both in advance and while on site (checking in and nearly every day) that this was our anniversary celebration - and they did absolutely nothing to acknowledge it. Even a card would have meant a lot. Every other Harrahs we have visited had more leeway in assuring guests pleasure.On the final afternoon, one of the Hosts, Sherrie, was kind enough to give us a comp so we had lunch to take on the plane. As so many others have said, the casino is very, very tight - you don't get the play for your money that makes it really fun. I would return anyway, because I have wonderful friends in New Orleans. Most of the staff was friendly and as helpful as they were able to be - but they do not go the extra mile for you.

Reviews.Title: “First time, very impressed. Our new NOLA home”
Reviews.Author: RTR1989
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for my birthday trip so we would be near the casino and the riverfront/Quarter. Parking was close by (and free with some play in the casino). The hotel itself is very nice. The staff was extremely friendly, like we found at all Caesar's locations. The room was average size, but included a mini-fridge and plenty of usable space. The bed was extremely comfortable. Now the bathroom, that is the way to do the bathroom. The huge tub, glass shower and separate room for the toilet was a nice touch. The motel is only a short walk to either the river front street car or the Canal street car. The casino is accessible through a tunnel so you never even have to go out in the weather to visit it (which was great in the middle of August).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Great Location..Great Rooms...and Great service!”
Reviews.Author: cjaeris
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference for 4 days. It's centrally located and a short distance from almost everything. Though this is a Harrah's the hotel is across the street from the Casino. The rooms (at least mine was!) are BEAUTIFUL with plenty of space. The service here was wonderful and the people that work here are very helpful and friendly. I had such a GREAT experience that I am definitely planning to come back on vacation at some point with my family and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice in every way plus awesome view!”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: Harrah's Hotel - still seems like new. From the beautiful entry and friendly greetings from the staff to the room with a splendid view of the Mississippi River. Clearly a 4 star hotel. From the ample bathroom with separate tub and shower and private toliet to the comfortable king size bed with nice white linens. Parking like most places in the Quarter, wasn't easy but was free if you play enough in their casino. I played roughly for 30-45 minutes each day we stayed. Check by swiping your card at the kiosk their and it will print out a parking pass.

Reviews.Title: “alittle overpriced and locals skip casino because horribly tight but location is a good one downtown”
Reviews.Author: johnverse68
Reviews.Content: employees were friendly and its right near the river but payouts are worst anywhere that I have encountered at casino and locals voiced they go to gulfport or st charles because its so bad there but location of hotel is within walking distance to riverboat which is nice and a nice aquarium on riverfront boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “top of the line in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: peterkut
Reviews.Content: quality is the standard for this hotel. service, cleanliness,convenience,location,size of room, i could go on and on. you will not be dissapointed . accross from casino,three blocks from burboun st, 1/2 block from troley , again i could go on and on, uoy get the picture

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & great staff”
Reviews.Author: OverjoyedK
Reviews.Content: This hotel & staff is top-notch, the rooms were elegant and me & my friends did not want for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: freckles97
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for our 30th anniversary. Had 4 nights comped; when we arrived I mentioned that it was our anniversary and we were upgraded to a corner suite on the 21st floor with a view of the river. Outstanding room, fantastic room service, unparallelled staff. We have stayed in Harrah's properties in Vegas, Tahoe, Reno and are monthly visitors to Atlantic City, but this hotel is far and away the best of them all. Beautiful hotel and casino. My only disappointment was that the casino is just as tight if not tighter than all the other Harrah's casinos. I sort of expected it, so it really was no surprise.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place”
Reviews.Author: texasredtop
Reviews.Content: This is still my favorite hotel. The rooms are large and spotless. The bed is heaven. The view is fabulous (get a river view). The staff is the best staff at any hotel I've ever stayed at. Parking is either valet or free in the casino parking garage with 30 minutes continuous play per day at the casino but you have to move your car out and back in or lose the free parking for that day. If you come and go a lot, it's best to just valet and pay the parking fees. It rained the 5 days we were there last week so it was nice to just walk across the street to the Riverwalk Mall or walk through the tunnel to the casino. Harrah's New Orleans' staff could teach all other hotels how to make their customers feel welcomed and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, beautiful hotel but parking was a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettergrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous inside out! We stayed in a luxury room on the 5th floor. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was huge and had a seperate shower/tub. However, the room description listed a LCD television but it was just a regular tv in our room. The room also didn't have a microwave, which would have came in handy. But it did have a refrigerator. The hotel does have a great location. Its within walking distance to the riverwalk, aquarium, and the superdome. The french quarter is a bit longer of a walk so you might consider taking the trolley. The parking here could also give you a headache. We decided to self park since the garage is right next door. But when we got ready leave the next day there was an issue with getting our parking ticket validated. Since we didn't play at the casino the hotel wouldn't validate our parking. So everytime we left the garage attendant would charge per hour of parking, which came up to $60 after a 2 night stay. Then at checkout the hotel tried to charge us again for parking! Unless you plan on playing at the casino everyday i suggest just using valet.

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF NEW ORLEANS BEST HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: NOLACajunQueen
Reviews.Content: HARRAH'S HOTEL is a 4 star rated hotel 1 block from downtown New Orleans and just across the street from HARRAH'S CASINO. There is an underground tunnel connecting the hotel and casino so ya never have to get out in the rain or the heat/humidity if ya don't want to. But seeing New Orleans is a MUST! The hotel staff is super effecient and very friendly and there to serve YOU! Two of the best steak places in the city are within the walls of this complex. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and Besh Steakhouse are equally awesome. (order the beef filet'..........OMG!) The beds in this hotel are fabulous......in fact we are ordering one to be delivered to our home......as are the linens and decor. Parking is expensive if you valet, $34 day, but you can park in the Harrah's Parking Garage for free and it's attached to the casino/hotel by elevator making it easy to tote your bags (or drop them off then go park). A taxi ride into the French Quarter is $10 for 4 people, or take the Riverfront Trolley for $1.50 (need exact change). There are one cup coffee pots in each room, however, there is no COFFEE SHOP or snack bar inside the hotel, but there is room service of course. There is a STARBUCKS in the casino. No pool at this hotel. This is a great place to stay and play in the city of New Orleans! Y'all have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, good service.”
Reviews.Author: RogersJan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Harrah's Hotel and spent time in the casino. The view from the room was breathtaking. The room was very comfortable, clean, and quiet. The hotel is located in a prime area in New Orleans. The aquarium, the ferry, as well as the wonderful streets full of shops and restaurants are all within walking distance from the hotel and casino. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ssandia
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is luxury at the moment when you step in. Amazing view to Piazza Italia. Everyrhing close to hotel streetcar and steamboat tour. Somebody write to visit Cafe Du Monde, we did and it was great. Carry a mini small umbrella or poncho for rainy days. Mother's food great.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in New Orleans -”
Reviews.Author: RItraveler79
Reviews.Content: Please allow me to ramble a bit. Harrah's New Orleans has a program that is called "Have I earned an A+ today?" I have never had such fantastic service from any place. From the moment I walked in to even going to the casino and having people asking me how is my stay, anything they can do for me. I utilized the conceirge. All were fantastic but Ebony went above and beyond from helping with day to day issues to, assisting with getting our flight home tickets. As far as the hotel, beautiful!!! Fantastic location. 1 block from River Walk, only a few blocks to get to Decateur St which takes you French quarter. Bourbon St is within walking distance 5 blocks. Hotel is near the aquarium, Mardi Gras World.. which has free shuttle to and from. I staed in Room 1020 ... 10th floor. located right near the elevator and was very quiet. huge HUGE bathroom, a bathtub that can hold me 6'3 person. seperate shower. All I can say is Harrahs did A+ service, quality and more.. being a 4 diamond AAA hotel, they lived up to the standards. and then some. anyone wants more info on what i did while there or what to see, email me.

Reviews.Title: “Good eating”
Reviews.Author: luvdaslots
Reviews.Content: We decided to check out Bambu for lunch. Had a $50 coupon, so why not? We checked the menu and decided to give it a try. We ordered the Honey Wasabi Glazed Shrimp and the Vietnamese Garlic Filet Tips. The beef tips are wok seared filet mignon sauteed with red onions. The meal came with Jasmine rice and an Asian salad with vinegarette for $26. The Wasabi Shrimp is fried in a creamy sauce with pecans for $20. Both orders were outstanding. We split the meals up so we could have some of each. There is more than enough food. You truly get the best bang for your buck there. Will definitely go whether or not I had a food coupon.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: jjluvsvegas
Reviews.Content: Met our Brother and Sister-in-law in New Orleans to celebrate their 20th anniversary. We could not have choosen a better place to stay! The staff was second to none. Everyone was so very friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful! Brother and Sister in Law were upgraded to a beautiful corner suite with a wonderful view of the river. My husband and I had a lovely king room, also with a great river view. Great location as well! Just a walk or trolley ride to almost anywhere. Thanks to all of the Harrah's New Orleans peeps that made our vacation a very pleasant and memorable one!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: dlbrownTuscaloosa_AL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times. It keeps on meeting and exceeding my expectations. Wonderful staff, great rooms, wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thegamblers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrahs, New Orleans and was very happy with such a clean, quiet hotel. The staff were all very helpful and went out of their way to help you. The Besh restaurant was very good with great service at Harrahs casino, A great surprise for our first time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kosomodc
Reviews.Content: I was offered comp rooms at Harrah's and took advantage of them. The hotel is nicely appointed. It's new and is close to the downtown activities. The beds were especially comfy. The bathroom was spacious and had a separate bath tub and shower as well as water closet. The staff were especially friendly and even remembered me although I didn't make many trips through the lobby. Parking is fine if you don't mind playing 30 minutes at the casino. I had two small, and minor issues. The beds had a metal frame that stuck out just where I would put my legs out when getting out of bed. I bumped my chins a couple of times. The other was that there was quite a bit of dust on the phones. Obviously, the phones aren't used that much, but it was just an observation. I got room service breakfast one morning. It was excellent with a great view of the river. The fact that wireless internet is quite expensive was not acceptable though; given the dependence many of us have on the internet. I will return again; a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for conventions and to downtown/French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JayL76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a convention. Location is outstanding as it is only steps away from the convention center. The riverwalk is also right across the street with all the shopping and sites right there. About a five minute walk to Bourbon Street. A word of advice, use the hotel lobby entrance and not the casino entrance after a long night on the French Quarter. Some negatives are the overall price and amenities like no pool or free Internet, but then again you're at a casino so they don't really want you anywhere but in the casino. Also, way too much authentic local food establishments so I never ate at the buffet. Recommend Mothers only a block away and Cafe Du Monde, a short walk up the Riverwalk on Decatur.

Reviews.Title: “What a great great!”
Reviews.Author: tscurtis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled alone on this trip and it was an actual vacation, not a conference where one or the other of us was tagging along! We stayed at Harrah's and we couldn't have been happier. Our room was comped at Harrah's but they treated us like we were paying top dollar. The room was clean and spacious,the bedding was wonderful and there was a great soaking tub in the bathroom. The hotel staff was accommodating, I asked for extra coffee packets in the room and it was taken care of each day after that. This was our 4th visit to New Orleans and we had never really taken advantage of the trolley before but our hotel was near the trolley line so we learned the routes and it really came in handy. We also walked quite a bit, it is just a few blocks from Bourbon Street. We also walked the river walk to my husband's favorite morning destination, the Cafe Du Monde! Speaking of breakfast, one morning I just wanted to have the little diner experience so we asked the concierge. She told us about the cafe across the street but I had already checked out there menu and it wasn't what I was looking for. Then she told us about Mother's and it was exactly what I was looking for! A breakfast special for less than $6, grits, eggs, biscuits, sausage and coffee, no substitutions, and you stand in line to place your order. My husband got the stack of 3 pancakes and they were so big he couldn't finish them. It is worth the visit just for the experience. We flew for two of our visits and we drove for two of our visits. I was really nervous about driving in this time because parking was such an issue when we came June 2010 with our family. Because we stayed at Harrah's this time we learned very quickly that parking wasn't an issue. As long as you play 30 minutes a day at the casino and swipe your Total Rewards card to validate it, there will be no charge to park and there are plenty of spaces. This was a real bonus. We ate at Besh Steak one evening and it was enjoyable. Our salads were wonderful! If there was a negative at all it would be that there is no pool and no free wireless. They do have a partner hotel right across the street that has a pool and Harrah's guests can use. I believe it is free for Total Reward card holders but be sure to confirm. As far as wireless, I am all about a hotspot in a hotel, it can be in the seating area of the lobby, I am not picky. I just want somewhere that I can connect my phone a couple of times a day to check email. That would be a great addition for Harrah's but not a deal breaker. There was nothing about this trip we didn't enjoy. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeriaMia
Reviews.Content: Never again am I going to stay at this hotel. We didn't even get the room I reserved and paid for. We had to get a handicapped accessible room which had just a huge walk in shower. No tub. The description of the room I reserved when booking stated that all luxury rooms have a clock radio w/iPod dock. We didn't. And no one informed us of the $50/night service fee charge in case there was any damage to the room. The clerk took my husbands credit card and swiped it and didn't tell us anything and u don't get it back until u check out. On top of all of this, there is bottled water in the room, but it's $6/bottle which is charged to u if u open it. Totally insane, and I promise I will never go back. Horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and view of the river”
Reviews.Author: TunicaSevenStar
Reviews.Content: We had one of the corner suites on the 17th floor..amazing view, beautiful room with a separate living room and dining area, which had a large flat screen tv in it. The bathroom was elegant and had the separate tub and shower that I always like to have, and granite vanities. I liked having the doorbell with a button you push for "do not disturb"...no one can ring the doorbell with it on, and there's no stealing of "do not disturb" signs...yay! The service was also excellent. Very attentive staff. Our room was comped, which made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no pool!”
Reviews.Author: CalgarySunworshiper
Reviews.Content: The service was fabulous and the room was beautiful - we had a one bedroom corner suite and it exceeded our expectations. Hotel staff is very attentive and friendly. Really enjoyed the casino and proximity to Bourbon street, the waterfront, shopping. Make sure you take a cab to Frenchman Street for the authentic jazz nite clubs. It was fabulous. Only disappointment with the hotel is that they have no pool - you are able to walk to the Hilton and use their pool but it was small and disappointing. With the summer heat I would have really enjoyed some pool time. Other tip - book a bike tour with bigeasybiketours.com - fabulous trip with Bob (fabulous guide). Also, Harrah's had a really good gym, the equipment was in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jldjd
Reviews.Content: Harrahs far exceeded my expectations. We stayed three nights, and upgraded to a suite, which was amazing. Huge living room, bedroom and bathroom. Really an elegant suite and so great to come home to! The entire staff was extraordinary... extremely friendly and helpful. The room had a wonderful view of the Mississippi River and the location cannot be beat. It is an easy walk to the French Quarter, as well as to the St. Charles streetcars. Though some had advised staying in some of the quainter hotels in the French Quarter area, we agreed that in fact it was wonderful to return to this beautiful hotel after a day of touring around New Orleans. As I said, I was truly impressed with this fine hotel, and highly recommend it to anyone travelling to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blondie_713
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, it has a magnificent t view of the might Mississippi and the bridge. The beds are comfy and the rooms are quiet. It nice to have a shower separate from the tub, and a door for the toilet :). The bathroom had premium amenities, which was nice. The room and the hotel itself were nicely decorated. The 2 things i didn't like was how far it was from Bourbon Street, i know you can take the trolley or take a cab, but after a loooong night partying in Bourbon Street the last thing you want is to have a long ride back to the hotel. Also, it doesn't have a pool but i guess the casino next door makes up for it. Regardelss of that, i would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rossandmary
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and comfortable beds. The service was wonderful. Short walk to casino. Trolley stop 1 block away. Great location overlooking the Mississippi!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: giftgrrl
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the JazzFest. We had stayed 4 nights at the Intercontinental, which was just ok. We got a comp offer from Harrah's, so stayed there the last night. I was surprised to find that our room was substantially larger and just better than the Intercontinental. Large bathroom, good water pressure, average bath amenities, lighted make up mirror. Room was big, with a seating area. Service was good. We've stayed all over NOLA. I would stay here again with no hesitation. We've stayed at Roosevelt,, IC, both W's, the Westin, Wyndham Riverfront in the past. I would say this is one of the better hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Our Hotel of Choice in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Bill J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to New Orleans several times throughout the year and our first choice is always the Harrah's Hotel. Okay, we are gamblers so the location to the casino is a definite plus but the reason we enjoy the hotel is because the staff is friendly and accommodating, the rooms are very well appointed, decorated nicely and very quiet (important to us after gambling and Bourbon St.). We've stayed at the Hilton Riverfront and the "W" across the street but neither of those compare to the Harrah's Hotel in my book. Even some of the smaller boutique hotels we have stayed at right on Bourbon just aren't worth the money for me. We'll be back to New Orleans soon and we will stay at the Harrah's.

Reviews.Title: “Commodious”
Reviews.Author: cactusflower10
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean rooms, great restaurants; within easy reach of The French Quarter and many attractions. This is our second visit and will only stay here in New Orleans. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Doowop72
Reviews.Content: The place (both inside and out) is immaculate! The staff is so friendly & accommodating! If you plan to visit New Orleans, there's no better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Never Fails to Deliver”
Reviews.Author: TX4me
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Harrah's. They never fail me on delivering a nice, clean room with friendly staff. The New Orleans Harrah's was excellent. My only complaint with Harrah's is that they charge for internet use. These days in a hotel of this quality, I expect free internet service. (note to Harrah's: Marriott has free Wi-Fi)

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, helpful staff. Clean rooms fast elevators.”
Reviews.Author: Kitcheneral
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after coming of a seven day cruise. The staff were polite and always helpful. Rooms were a good size. Bathroom was nice with a great tub to relax in. A few hundred yards from Canal street. The gentleman outside the front were friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Good Location:”
Reviews.Author: cpldutch
Reviews.Content: Although Harrah's has other hotels that they use around the casino, we choose this one thinking we were connected to the casino itself. You are through a underground hall but even like the parking garage it's a ways a way. Nice large rooms, clean and in great condition. Friendly efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beejans17
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to go to New Orleans on a comp from Harrah's. I left Philadelphia Thursday night and flew into New Orleans at 8:30. I limo was waiting for me at the Airport...how nice was that! When I arrived at the Hotel check in was all but five minutes. I have a Seven Star card so maybe that had something to do with it, but I also saw other guest and they all seem to be getting very good attention also. I went straight to my room to drop my bag off and another surprise awaited me. As soon as I opened the door I saw a beautiful basket with goodies on the wall table. I walked down the hall and into a beautiful suite. It was so nice; I wish someone else was there to see it. This is the second visit to New Orleans and both times I stayed at Harrah's. The room before this was very nice also; two queen beds and a large bathroom. This time the suite had a bathroom that was as large as my bedroom at home. A nice soaking tub and a separate glass shower, a built in white marble vanity with two sinks and stool between them. The entrance was through the bedroom. I don't think I can return without having this room. Everything went so well on this short trip. I had a comp for the buffet Thursday night. Friday night I had another comp for dinner at one of the restaurants Harrah is affiliated with so I chose Besh Steak House. It was a great surf and turf dinner. I had a wonderful nightâ€™s sleep and woke Friday morning feeling so rested. The bed was comfortable the pillows nice. I took a shower and went down to Canal Street for a walk. I have to say that every time I entered or left the property the employees at Harrahâ€™s where always greeting me with a smile. A nice touch especially since was alone. I stopped at CVS to buy bubble bath so I could relax in the tub before going out Friday night; I just could not leave without getting in that ceramic beauty. I spent most of Friday night in the Casino which is directly across the street from the hotel. You can either cross the street or use the underground tunnel to get there. I felt very safe even at 2:00 am. My wakeup call came at 4:30 Saturday morning. I showered and dressed quickly, took the elevator to the lobby and had them print my boarding pass. The limo driver was waiting inside the lobby and we left in a gorgeous stretch. We pulled up to the airport at 5:30. My flight too off on time and I was back in Philadelphia by 10:30. I canâ€™t wait to go back â€“ It just might be in a few weeksâ€¦..miss you Nola.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and unbelievable view.”
Reviews.Author: CardFanDubG
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews was not sure what to expect. When my wife and I checked in the clerk was very friendly and asked if we wanted a high or lower room. We asked for a high room with a view. Upon entering our room on the 24th floor we were amazed at the beautiful view of the Mississippi River. The room was very clean and the King Size bed very comfortable. We were glad to see that the room contained a refrigerator and safe. The bath was large and we enjoyed the glassed shower and large tub. I was attending a conference at the Hilton and found the walk to be a very easy block. The underground walk-way to the Casino was nice and made it very easy to get to. The parking was not as complicated as some reviews tried to make it. All you had to do is gamble 30 minutes within 24 hours of the time that you are taking the car out. There is a kiosk near the escalators to the underground walk-way. Slide your total rewards card through that and if you qualify you will receive a ticket for free parking. Very convenient. We ate at the buffet just because it was convenient and found it good but not outstanding. With all the great New Orleans restaurants though; who wants to eat in the Casino very often. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times & Celebration”
Reviews.Author: bamazed
Reviews.Content: Awesome good time in the Big Easy!!! we stayed for almost a week and enjoyed the great food, great people, & fun atmosphere. The rooms are very comfortable, very attentive staff, wish the hotel had a pool or area to relax outdoors. They offered the indoor pool at a hotel next door with a $10 charge. Other than that, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “let the good times roll”
Reviews.Author: Morvin147
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New Orleans from Dallas by road on March 12th and stayed at J.W Marriott few blocks away from Harrah's, I like to gamble while i am on leisure travel so Harrah's was a great opportunity, after reading reviews from trip advisor which i use very frequently when i am travelling to different destination so i dont waste my time and go to the right place, but i made an exception and still went to Harrah's Casino despite so many negative reviews. Harrah's is a good casino, its well kept and it looks as good as casinos in Las Vegas, Dealers are very friendly and they truly have a great crowd that goes there.. its a mix of older and middle age people having drinks and having a good time. as soon as you walk in, they check your I.D and make sure you are legal to gamble, to some people it must be annoying but i love the fact that they have people on their payroll, making sure only right people enter their facility and yes they run your driver liscense into three different things to make sure its not a fake I.D as most of us know, how easy it is to get a fake I.D. Everybody wears a name tag and a bage which says " did i provide you with A+ Service", looks like the things have started to change, they are trying their best to elevate service, But the drink service was really slow, i couldnt get a drink on a roulette table for good 30-45 min wait on three ocassions i was there. On their end, they have Iphones and guest service managers on the floor taking orders but it is not working for some reason, they need to change that system and just assign servers on certain areas of the casino. Other than that, i had a great time at this casino, they have a poker room a really big one, a bar with poker machine, huge selection of slots, roulette table, black jack tables and anything you can think of. Over all my experience was really great because of the friendliness of the staff and genuine concern and care they provided even when i complained and they tried harder to fix the issue. I will be back at Harrah's when i come next time to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: naturekid
Reviews.Content: Let me qualify this review by noting our stay was comped. That's why the value rating is only average. I Don't think I would pay the $200+ a night they want through the website. That being said, It was a very nice hotel room. spacious bathroom, work desk and couch with coffee table perfect for room service. the view of the city and the sunset was awesome, unless your an early riser and enjoy sunrises, then ask for a river view. The room would proabaly be considered a "mini' suite in other hotels. The only drawback was the air seemed heavy/muggy but dry at the same time no matter where we put the t-stat. The staff was super friendly always saying "have a nice day" on your way out in the morning, and "welcome back "in the eve. Room service seemed steep even by room-service standards. Two cheeseburgers set us back about $45. I'm almost certain the food comes from the gordon biersch restaurant downstairs, as the $20 dollars "buffalo style wings" I ordered came in a asian sauce. the one and only kind they serve at the restaurant. If it's before midnight, your better of f calling in a take out order to the restaurant and running down yourself. I'll keep that in mind for next time, as we can't wait to return to the beautiful city of new orleans and Harrah's!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - quiet rooms and comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: lisa3960
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a Mardi Gras weekend and there was no noise at all. The room was very nice, the beds were really comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The housekeeping was efficient, and extra towels were brought upon our request. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC TIME”
Reviews.Author: kreinmo1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Harrahs for 5 days. The staff was great from the bellman to the front desk and concierge. Our room was ready when we got there early in the day and was nice sized , clean and airy. we had no complaints. the location was great near the casino and only a few blocks from The French Quarter. very one we met was friendly and helpful. we took Plantation Tour with Cajun Encounters, it was great.We ate at Brennans, Nola,, Commanders Palace and Domenica. all were top notch. all in all a great trip and we look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean modern rooms, nice casino, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: JACKPO
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with beautiful room and bathroom and grounds. PROS: CLEAN, modern, spacious, quiet, large casino, lots of amenities. CONS: Bell hop service disappointing, buffet was disappointing, far walk to french quarter (especially when it's cold).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option... especially for gambling convenience”
Reviews.Author: travelingfun101
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the upscale nature of this hotel. I generally find that "casino hotels" are a bit "tired" for all the wear. My deluxe room was very clean and quiet and had a comfy king bed w/heavy comforter. The bathroom had the deepest tub I've ever seen in addition to an appealing glass enclosed shower. I was very happy here, particularly for the convenience of walking back to my room after a late night at the casino. The lobby/check-in was well staffed and friendly, and eager to help on a moment's notice. FYI - be sure to get a Harrah's card at the casino and have it validated at the front desk in order to get free parking.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasNana57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to get a great rate for a couple of days to celebrate our anniversary. This is our third time to stay here. The hotel is beautiful and the location is conveniant. I asked for and received a room with a river view, on the 18th floor, which was awesome. The room was very clean, nice.......with a desk, couch, chair, very comfortable bed. The bathroom is huge....nice makeup mirror, coffeemaker, separate shower, large tub, separate toilet room, with plenty of towels. Everyone at the desk and in the lobby is extremely friendly and helpful. It's a short walk to the Riverwalk Mall for beignets in the morning. It's very conveniant to catch the Canal Streetcar, short walk to the French Quarter. There is a free shuttle to Mardi Gras World and I found out later that same shuttle could have taken us to the World War II museum. But we enjoyed the ride on the St. Charles streetcar out there anyway. Harrah's parking garage is right around the corner with "free" 24-hour parking for 30 minutes play in the casino. My husband had a winning streak and I had a losing streak, but we both had fun. Dislike: We each had 2 flat pillows to sleep on and the internet is not free. Another night and I would have asked for new pillows. Otherwise, another great stay at Harrah's in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paula M
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time staying at Harrahs and we've never been disappointed. The rooms are immaculate and a nice size, the bed is so comfortable, and the bathroom is roomy with a nice soaking tub. We like that the hotel is small. The front desk staff is a pleasure to deal with as is the bell and valet staff. A-1 service all the time. Room service is prompt and while not inexpensive, the food is delicious and served hot or cold as appropriate. The location is ideal for walking to the riverfront, the Quarter, and the Convention Center, as well as shopping and many restaurants. We enjoy Besh Steak and Bambu in the casino - first rate food in a casual setting. The buffet is hit or miss but is handy for a late night meal. If available, do try one of the corner suites - they are "true" suites with two separate rooms and very spacious. But the regular rooms are also quite nice. The cleanliness of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff make up for the absence of a pool and spa. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific room/great location!”
Reviews.Author: OffWeGo2
Reviews.Content: Was comp-ed a room at Harrah's New Orleans so we stayed here one of the three nights we were in New Orleans. The customer service was great, the hotel room was immaculate and it was convenient to everything. It's hard to complain about a free room but the cost of parking was a little off-putting - $30/night. However, if you go into the casino and keep your slot card active for 30 minutes, then your parking is free. That wasn't too hard to do, but others considering staying at the hotel should be aware of this. No complaints at all about the hotel - it was an easy walk down to Jackson Square and the lower part of the French Quarter and the Canal Street Streetcar is just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Court18
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans after Christmas to scout some hotels for our Family Reunion coming up in July. Ended up staying at Harrah's because my mom got a comped room. To start off parking is steep ($30 something dollars) , however if you play atleast 30 minutes on your Total Rewards Card you get 24hours of parking for free in the casino's parking garage (self park). We stayed Monday-Wednesday and didn't pay one penny for parking. Another thing one should note is that Harrah's Casino and Harrah's hotel are not one in the same. They are actually across the street from each other. However, there is a nice covered walkway/tunnel that connects the two. The hotel's location is great. Steps away from the Riverwalk, the Aquarium and the French Quarters. You are in prime walking distances for many activities. The room itself was very nice and equipped with a large tv and mini fridge. There was even a doorbell for each room and an electric indicator to press if you did not want to be disturubed of if you need housekeeping. My favorite part of the room was the bathroom. It was HUGE! Walk in shower, separate tub big enough for two people. Lastly, the toilet was separated by a door from the rest of the bathroom. Housekeeping was very attentive along with the other staff. Many times when I came and left I was greeted by someone at the front door and the bellmen were very helpful when trying to hail taxis. We didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel, but we did eat at the buffet in the casino. It was okay, not the best but not terrible either. My mother and her friend visited Steak and Bamboo (I believe that was the name of it), they were not impressed with the food and stated that the hostess was very rude because they did not have a reservation. We also ate at McCalisters in the casino. The food tasted nothing like the McCalisters I have been to. In addition, I had to send my 'sweet' tea back because clearly it was unsweetened. When they gave me another one, still no luck so I just gave up. All in all a great hotel, prime location. Though, I would venture out for food.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay...”
Reviews.Author: 55chicos
Reviews.Content: i would like recommend this hotel... the staff with very helpful and what a town... just can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Love this place !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: daginty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and this place is great. I get free rooms so I can't complain about the price. Besh steakhouse is really good, best filet i ever had. Yes they are expensive but most of the top level restaurants are. Rooms are very nice with great bedding. If you do gamble make sure you grab a total rewards player card. This card gets you comps for your play and free or reduced rooms at all of the harrah's properties. The staff was always polite and helpfull. I am heading back down in January can't wait. Jeff C.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: highroller50
Reviews.Content: I was gaming at New Orleans Harrah casino last month. I had the worst experience ever. Dealer and cashier were very rude. No customer service at all. This casino need to teach there employee some customer service. Restroom needs cleaning. I will never come to this casino again. I am also a seven star member. I will report this to management

Reviews.Title: “Great view, friendly staff and clean as a whistle.”
Reviews.Author: Evaluator1
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay and we have both travelled ito many destinations. Fast efficient check in and check out; bravo- great job!

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's Hotel is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: NC-Kid
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly. Room was ready when promised and was clean and bright. Linens in order. We were on the 24th floor so traffice, sirens, trains etc were not too noticable! Great views of the river and downtown! Absolutely great beds to sleep in! Besh Steak is really good! Buffet superb as well! Casino a little tight...but who isin't right now?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...everyone was very helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: 1weeniedog
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec. 1st & 2nd for our Anniversary. Had a wonderful room on 19th floor overlooking the river. The pillow top mattress was very comfortable and the room was nice size and very clean. Enjoyed the HDTV , stereo radio, and fridge. Next time i'll try to get a corner room, they are a lot bigger. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I was born and raised in New Orleans and surrounding areas. Now living in Slidell, La. but visit N. O. often. We have friends and family riding in the Endemyon Parade on Mardi Gras weekend and will try to stay here at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great atmoshphere, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kmkPA
Reviews.Content: Pulled up to hotel via taxi, bellman took bags immediately to front desk and I was checked in with my room key within minutes! The room was clean and beautiful (my favorite Harrah's room so far, including Vegas and Atlantic City). Found that our nightstand had a damaged rear leg, but nothing major. Robes and an umbrella in the closet for guest use (what a nice surprise to fin). Lots of city information available in our room. Loved that there was a fridge in the room and found out that many hotels do not have them. The bellmen and front desk staff greeted us upon each arrival and departure. Our room was cleaned, bed made daily, towels changed upon request. Oh, and if you've never slept in a Harrah's bed, you will understand my love for them after you do! Great location for riverfront activities and not too far of a walk to Bourban St. We tried to fit it all in during our 5 day stay, but it wasn't possible so we plan on going back for sure! Loved the city, the architecture, the food, the people! Did not expect to have as much fun as we did! The casino was clean and even though there is smoking throughout, you don't smell it unless someone is sitting right next to you smoking. Wish the Starbuck's was closer to the other end of the casino, closer to the hotel, but of course we know why it isn't and it worked EVERY time! We also enjoyed the taxi whistle that the Harrah's crew uses! The room size was incredible and the bathroom was great. Enjoyed the 2 person tub size for a bit of relaxation. We did not use room service, seemed a little pricey, but I don't use it anyway in a city where getting out and about is part of the fun! We did the Steamboat Natchez for lunch and would do it again. The $10 extra for the lunch is worth it and there are coupons for discounts online. The bread pudding, the fried chicken and jambalaya were the best. IMAX Katrina was breathtaking...a must! We felt completely safe in and around this property. Actually, even in the hustle and bustle of the events on Bourban St, everyone is just having a good time and we felt completely safe, especially with the police presence on horses all night. We loved our stay and are thankful to the Harrah's staff for helping to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: JIPrincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's for the long Halloween weekend. The hotel is in very close proximity to Riverwalk, shopping, and Harrah's Casino right next door. The Hilton is also next door and Drago's Restaurant is on the street floor of the Hilton. Drago's is the home of the Original Charbroiled Oyster--yum. The rooms at Harrah's are comfortable, but not elaborate. Hotel staff are friendly and hospitable. Everyone in New Orleans is friendly and hospital. Cafe DuMonde resides on the Riverwalk, where you can stroll along the Mississippi, drink coffee with chickory and breakfast on Beignets with powdered surgar. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: fenton27
Reviews.Content: Went to Harrah's for four nights. Comped suite was great. Location wonderful. Steakhouse, Gordon's, room service and the buffet all good. Nanchez Steamboat enjoyable but food was awful - take the ride but do not have the dinner. Hotel staff wonderful. Bourbon Street was crazy. Liquor store and items in store across the street from the casino. Casino was loose, several good hits.

Reviews.Title: “With other options available, why stay here?”
Reviews.Author: Prepwade
Reviews.Content: Our stay wasn't horrible but it wasn't great. Service throughout the property was bad. No one knew what was going on. Overall, it is a nice and clean hotel but lots of little things add up. The housekeeper didn't leave soap in the room, the showers were cold and no water pressure. The hotel has no amenities except a small gym but you can use the services at loews for an extra fee. My recommendation, just go to Loews and save the hassle. The W is close as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLinda0410
Reviews.Content: I have never been disappointed in a Harrah's hotel and this was no exception. The room was spacious and the bathroom was fantastic. We had a room on the 24th floor with a great view of the Mississippi River. The room was clean and since we had a king size bed there was an ample sitting area with couch, chair and table. The bed was super comfortable. The service at this hotel is top of the line. Each staff member was courteous and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and pampered. The casino is directly across the street from the hotel and the food and staff there were wonderful as well. One drawback, you have to pay for internet access. I think Harrahs should make this service part of the room fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: baileytopaz
