Reviews.Content: I was worried about not staying so close to Bourbon street and walking at night, but my worries were for nothing. This was a very nice hotel and the walk was short and safe. We went to Nola's for dinner and walked back and felt completely safe. The hotel is very clean and the beds are comfortable. The parking is free if you gamble for a half an hour. The breakfast buffet was very good for the price. I would recomend anyone to stay here and walk instead of dealing with the crowds and run down hotels on Bourbon Street or in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Tennis850
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 20th floor looking over the river it was GREAT! It was nice to have a fridge in the room to save on expenses. It was a good deal to get free parking for gambling and I came home from the casino with the money I went with.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: MrMar
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to the Crescent City. We decided to take advantage of a 7 Stars Signature Event in early May. We actually drove from New Jersey so can't comment on air travel and service to and from airport. At arrival we were greeted graciously by hotel staff and check in was fine. We changed rooms because the first one assigned was without view. We were then assigned a nice room with great view of the river. The room was very clean and the service was great during our entire stay of 5 nights. The whole event was very memorable but we must point out that the staff was geared to be extra accomodating to impress the guests on hand. However, we travel to many HET properties and found this is by far the best. The proximity to the French Quarter with so many great choices for dining is great. We look forward to returning perhaps later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all the way around”
Reviews.Author: nteachey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the last year, and each time the staff and accomodations were outstanding. The rooms were immaculate, and cleaned frequently. Each night we returned to the room, the beds were turned down, with special treats by the bed. The staff on both occassions were able to arrange early check in's, as I always like to take early flights into NO. The view from our rooms is always amazing. I can't think of one negative thing to say about this hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs New Orleans is Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaSunny
Reviews.Content: We have visited/stayed/played at numerous Harrah's properties (Cherokee, NC, Tunica, MS, Las Vegas, St. Louis, Indiana, and New Orleans, LA). Our most recent HET stay was at Caesars Palace (August 2010) and prior to that New Orleans (June 2010) Our favorite by far is New Orleans, and we have a return trip planed in October and December on 3 night stays. What makes New Orleans our favorite? The HOTEL is just beautiful! Rooms are even equipped with a mini-fridge and coffee pot. Room service is outstanding and the housekeeping staff and the upkeep of the rooms are stellar! From the moment You enter the lobby You are greeted by professional and friendly staff and the check in front desk personnel go out of their way to accommadate your individual needs. Want a great view of the river, just ask, if its available, its yours for the asking. The partner RESTAURANTS within the casino and on Fulton Street are excellent. We have dined at Grand Isle Seafood Restaurant, Besh Steak, Gordon Biersch, and all are highly recommended. We enjoyed Fuddruckers for a quick lunch, but did not like McAllisters Deli (expensive price for a sub-standard sandwich that was not generous with meat portions and the bread was stale). And, Gordon Biersch has a great happy hour with speciality cocktails and tasty delicious appetizers, its a must do every visit. The CASINO has a great mix of slot machines (reel and video) with varied denominations. The beverage service on the floor is very prompt, tip a little bit extra ($5 for the first round), and they're ready to serve you again before You're ready for the next cocktail. Its a fun casino, very Mardi-Gras themed and so eye appealing, and love the marching brass band that parades through the Casino every night! We don't typically dine at the BUFFET, as there are way too many other great restaurants to dine at in New Orleans and on property, can't comment on it, except as we walked past a few times we noticed extremely long wait lines. For those that have yet to visit, Harrah's is a close walk to the French Quarter for great local music and Pat O'Briens famous hurricane cocktails. The Aquarium is just a couple of blocks away. We fly in to New Orleans, and are shuttled to the Hotel courtesy of Harrah's, but we see no need to rent a car while in New Orleans, most everything we like to do is within short walking distance. Two weeks from today, and we will be there again! We love the people of New Orleans, and those accents, everyone is so friendly and courteous. Its just an all-around FUN place to be, we love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: jkjone01
Reviews.Content: Went there for a 5 night vacation. I usually stay in the Quarter, rooms that are unique, antique, with that old world French Quarter feel. I decided to stay at Harah's this trip, in part because they comped us a room. The room was very very nice, clean, new. The bed was very comfortable. The bathtub huge and luxurious. The front desk staff were very polite with great customer service. The one thing that was a little annoying was the housekeeping forgot to stock up the coffee daily. We survived it though, by openning the door and stealing it off the housekeeper's cart! Overall, very very nice. I will stay there again if I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice centralized location”
Reviews.Author: tti1texas
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed my stay. As a new visitor to NOLA, the directions from this website could be improved tho. I drove from East Texas & the directions were very good except when you get to the corner of S Peters & Poydras the 1st thing you see is the Harrahs Casino across the street. I assumed the hotel & casino were all one property, it's not. As you're driving on S Peters you need to make a right into the hotel before crossing Poydras. Or as the directions on the site says, turn R on Poydras & go to the parking garage. Thats fine as long as you're not checking in the hotel. If you stay at the hotel, just pull into the hotel 1st to check in, then go to the parking garage. I also think as a guest of the hotel, valet parking should be comped. As a gambler tho, the parking garage is validated with your play time in the casino. I look forward to my next visit to NOLA. Had a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel7missouri
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 3 nights.location is perfect.rooms are very nice and the staff extremely helpful and friendly.i look forward to staying here again.my only negative comment would be the buffet is not as good as other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great room, but skip the buffet.”
Reviews.Author: frogmoretiger
Reviews.Content: Harrah's had the most enthusiastic staff. They were professional, eager to serve, always greeting you, and just super friendly. Check in and check out was a breeze. Room was excellent with a great bathroom. Our veiw was the Loews hotel but I did not come to look out the window. Location was great. Cable cars are convenient taking you to French quarter, Bouban Street, (both within walking distance) and cable down St. Charles is convenient also. Buffet for dungeness crab was good but over priced. Lunch buffet was average at best. Of the two days we ate, one day the fried food was soggy not crisp, like it was fried in not hot enough grease. Breakfast buffet was terrible. Wonder what the meat is, not enough choice, and overpriced. Slot selection was great. Many new machines. Slots were tight. If I didn't gamble (play only thirty minutes and your parking voucher is swiped), and stayed at the hotel, I would not like to pay the 25-30 dollars a day to park.

Reviews.Title: “HARRAHS IS LOSING IT”
Reviews.Author: blpeter
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night stay at Harrahs and was assigned Room 1120. Upon my entry to the room, I discovered that the carpet was filthy. There were dirty spots on the carpet between the beds and next to the window. The carpet was torn where the marble meets the carpet. I called downstairs to advise the front desk. I was told that there were no other rooms available and someone would be up to shampoo the carpet . I was asked to leave the room for an hour to allow the staff to shampoo the carpet. Thank God, it was only 4 in the afternoon. We left the room and upon our return about 3 hours later, nothing had been done to the carpet. I spoke with the front desk and they assured me it would be taken care the next day. We decided to drive to Destin the next day and this would give the hotel staff time to make the necessary changes to the room. When we returned that night, NOTHING had been done. The carpet was still dirty AND there was a leak from the A/C and as a result of the leak, the room also smelled of mildew!! I immediately called downstairs and complained. Several technicians were sent to the room and confirmed that there was indeed a leak from the a/c. Our luggage which had remained in the room was wet from the a/c leak. I was told that because there was a convention in town they had no other rooms. I inquired about other properties in the area. Harrahs arranged from me to get a room at Loews. It was 10 p.m and WE were responsible for getting our luggage across the street to the Loews property. Harrahs is a nice property but management needs to do more to maintain it. Otherwise, it will be just another dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “Parking”
Reviews.Author: Wonderful220
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice. Parking is a big time problem. Everytime you leave out the parking garage you have to play or pay . Hotel guest should have a one time fee for 24 hrs. Several employees inside casino are unsure about the parking rules. Just a warning have plenty of extra money to dish out for parking, its very costly. Carpet in room is stained and torned in certain areas. Hotel is located in nice area. Machines could be a little more lose.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Harrahs Property I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: laDerrica1
Reviews.Content: It was breath taking to walk into the hotel. The lobby was very exquisite. I'm a very ticky person and hotel bathrooms must meet my standards. This hotel exceeded beyond my expectations. Very well maintained. The mirrowed elevator area had no finger prints. The casino was great. I did not win any money, but I did not care because my stay there was flawless. I would definitely recommend this Harrahs Property to anyone that loves a clean and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stellar hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SelmaF847
Reviews.Content: beautiful immaculately kept hotel across from casino concierge staff gave flawless service so very welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTraveler33
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with everything you need close by. The view was awesome, staff always helpful and available. We didn't lack for anything. I asked a question about the location of a restaurant and immediately the concierge was on the phone confirming their hours making a reservation. Certainly A+ service. Even if you don't plan on gambling, I'd say stay here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but close.”
Reviews.Author: AWisconsintravler
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels my wife and I have ever stayed at. Rooms large and luxurious. Bathroom to good to be true; seperate shower and tub and of a very high quality! Toilet area in it's own room within the bathroom, plenty of space. The only downside of the hotel itself was the water................... no cold water! Yes, I know, usually people complain that they wait forever for hot shower water, not here. You can run the cold water for an hour and it remains bath tub warm. Not so great if you want a cold glass to wash down your meds, etc. The bottled water offered at $6 per made me sparingly drink the tap to wash down my meds. Other than that, an A++++++++++++ place. Great location near the Riverwalk and French 1/4. On a side note, Ruth's Chris Steak House is located in the hotel. A great one time place to eat. Once you've paid 2x-3x for what you can get elsewhere, the charm wears off. A $100+ bill for two with one glass of wine each is way to much and certainly not worth it. We did a 30th Anniv. dinner so it was a one timer. I have no problem spending money, Harrah's wasn't cheap, but foolishly is another question.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: ant0923
Reviews.Content: harrah's hotel and casin was a very nice stay i spend two nites there beatful rooms, had a king bed free wifi .a little high priced but well worth it if you book during the week it will be cheaper than the weekend and after playing in there casino for 30 minutes you get free parking a 28 dollare value from the hotel you walk thur a tunnel to there casino ,you don't need to cross the street very very nice place

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stephmark08
Reviews.Content: First time visitors to New Orleans and we had our hotel room comped (we frequent Atlantic City) so we weren't expecting the best location/hotel...but once we got there and figured out the area we decided that this is ultimatley the best location to stay when visiting Nawlins. Next to the pier(small shopping mall/great seafood rest. where you can sit outside and enjoy the water/good aquarium) and blocks away from the main street to get all public transportation. The hotel was beautifull, staff was really knowledgable and helpfull, we would not stay ANYWHERE else, even if we had to pay for the rooms we would pick this hotel. No rental car needed even if you wanted to go to the zoo (loved it there) public transportation is great and people are very helpfull!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel..... but..........................”
Reviews.Author: dontask94
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,friendly and helpful staff! Location... hnmmmm okay. They said they would comp my 34.00 a day parking with 30 mins of play but when ask to do so they said oh... thats only in the self parking not valet... (well they are the same price.. 34.00 self park or 34.00 valet which would you choose? Of course I chose the valet. Never was I told that this was not part of the comp deal. and we played way more that 30 mins everyday.Cmon they lie and cheat and its not nice to do that to your customers. Tell the truth the first time and people will not get mad. I would stay at a Marriott of the W. At least you know what to expect and no lies I hope>

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cdbetan
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with 5 guys, one of them being my boyfriend, and it was their choice to stay there, because they wanted easy access to gambling. I'm SO glad we stayed at Harrah's. Although I like to gamble, it wasn't my main objective....my main objective was to sight see. Harrah's was PERFECT for that. You are able to walk out on the street and have things to do immediately. It's right across the street from the Riverwalk (we had a view of it from our room....SO pretty against the river), across the street from the aquarium and within a very short walking distance of The French Quarter (a MUST see!). The rooms were well appointed and spotless. It was quiet and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Least Favorite Harrah's Brand Casino Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MPHSCOUPLE
Reviews.Content: Visited the casino while staying in New Orleans at another hotel. Of all of the Harrah's affiliated casinos in Vegas, Mississippi and Missouri that I have visited, this was by far my least favorite and most un-Harrah's-like of all. Firstly, the mixture of slots was geared heavily toward video machines rather than the traditional reel types. There were no Wheel of Fortune or similar types that are in every other casino I have been in elsewhere. At least three machines malfunctioned when trying to cash out with a ticket. One instance resulted in a 30 minute wait to have the machine repaired so that I could get my money out of it. Three employees approached me and the machine and said they would send help. But, only after 30 minutes did anybody actually hae the ability to help me. The roulette dealers at two tables seemed less than able to keep up with the play at their tables and it took an extremely long time to get from one spin to the next. The casino is very attractive and is a huge draw for the city. I really was surprised that this casino could provide a trade of the Total Rewards points in my account for restaurant vouchers at some of the best restaurants in New Orleans. This is amazing! But, the experience in the gambling time spent at this casino left me totally frustrated and I will never return for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and lots of good choices at and around the hotel to do”
Reviews.Author: ellis22922
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was in a wonderful location, close to all the highlights. Casino was fun, but didn't win much. Hotel staff wonderful and the rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you are in New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: LeAnn W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome...from the minute we arrived. Staff was excellant...room was very nice and beds were comfortable. Wish we could of stayed a couple more nights!

Reviews.Title: “OMG, What a Great place !”
Reviews.Author: chas29644
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, and had a blast. The front desk employees are the best. Food was great, bartender- a lady over at the bar with the poker machines...she was the best ever..she sang, and when you tipped her, she was truly thankful, I did not get her name, I think she was Irish??? This is such a party place. Got an upgrade to the most beautiful room ever!!!!!! Thank you front desk for the wonderful trip....All of your staff go the extra mile, yall should be proud....

Reviews.Title: “stay away from the buffet”
Reviews.Author: flanurse
Reviews.Content: We went on a day trip to New Orleans Harrahs casino, had comps for lunch and some free play. The casino is beautiful, lots of fun won a little money. We decided to use our food comp for the buffet. This is absolutely the worst food we have ever tasted (I did not say eat). Everything "looked" decent but was cold. The iced tea was sour and when I finally got the waitress to change to a soda she nodded like she knew it - we never saw her again. The pizza was burned on the bottom. The sliced BBQ pork was ice cold. The only thing half way pleasant was the tamales but they weren't very good. The lettuce was wilted and the desserts looked like a home ec class made them. The kicker was when I gave the cashier the comp she did not ask for any ID or my players card (this is the first time in many, many casinos I have never been asked for ID), maybe it was because she was on her TELEPHONE!!!!!. We will go back to play in the casino but NEVER, EVER eat at the buffet again. It was very surprising that it was so horrible given it is NEW ORLEANS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalLoCal81
Reviews.Content: I made a trip to New Orleans and decided on Harrahs to stay at. This is the best location i couldve imagined. Located right in the center of downtown you can easily walk to the Audobon and River Walk! The price was moderate and comparable with the Hilton. Great Gaming, i didnt eat here unfortunatly i was just too busy trying as many of the New Orleans local eateries as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RainToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights after leaving Hilton and what a difference! The front desk personnel , valets, housekeeping were all very friendly. Rooms are very clean and quiet. They had wonderful complimentary coffee and tea served on silver trays by a very friendly gentleman wearing white gloves in the lobby on one of the mornings of our stay. Ice water with tons of lemons throughout the day also served in the lobby. They go that extra mile for their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bebe_FortWorth_Texas
Reviews.Content: I go to New Orleans several times a year. This is now the only hotel I stay at. The rooms are bigger than your average hotel. The bathrooms are huge and the bathtub and shower are separate. Every staff member I have encountered has been very friendly. We arrived very early on our last visit and checked in with the front desk. We knew our room would not be ready that early but they took my cell phone number and called when it was. We still got in a couple of hours before actual check in time. The casino is big and has several places to eat. Of course you don't have to eat at the casino there is no shortage of good food in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “So much more then I expected”
Reviews.Author: PatsfanMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to New Orleans, and first time at Harrah's, it was totally more then I expected. The hotel staff was so overly friendly we actually kind of found the first couple people fake, then realized everyone was like this! Truly, the staff I can not say enough, everyone says hi, welcomes you in, says bye when you leave, holds the doors for you, I even went out in the middle of the night alone for a cigarette and felt like it was 2 pm and not 2 am with the amount of workers in the area. This hotel is kept immaculate. They hose down the driveway at night, clean all the handles, on all doors and the rooms are just beautiful. I did read the reviews on the buffet, but we still opted to try it for dinner one evening, it was fine, I did notice one of the waitstaff cleaning a chair, then the table, then the top of the salt and pepper shakers with the same dirty rag, and that was gross, thank goodness I had finished eating at that point. She could have used a few sterilization tips from the hotel staff. The casino is fine, lots to choose from, but didn't have any luck. There is a nice bar in the casino with a ice ring all around to keep your drinks cold. They did not have satellite TV which was a bummer as we would have liked to watch our local teams play. I highly reccomend Harrah's for the comfort, beauty and location to anyone coming to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LeighW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were give 4 free nights at the Harrah's Hotel in New Orleans as a comp offer. We had never been to New Orleans before. This was one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom was very large and nice. They give you free robes to wear while you stay there. Free coffee in room, and a newspaper every morning. The staff throughout the hotel, casino, and restaurants were so friendly and nice. We ate in the Besh Steakhouse and had a wonderful dinner. And also at the Gordon Biersch Brew House and my husband ordered a second cup of the gumbo - he thought it was the best he'd had. Overall, this hotel truly deserves a 4 star rating. And we will be back. New Orleans was a great place to go. We want to return again next year. We took an airboat swamp tour with Airboat Adventures and we had Capt. Sammy. We recommend this to everyone. Overall, best vacation ever. And we even won some money in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Harrah's takes a back seat to no one”
Reviews.Author: rsgtx
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at Harrah's in New Orleans as part large group, and from the minute I checked I could tell it was extremely well managed. The rooms are very well decorated and comfortable-especially the 18" deep bathtubs which are great after a long day on your feet. I especially found the employees at the front desk and the lobby, like IVY, very pleasant and caring in a sincere way. The catering of our events was very well managed and food quality was excellent. Beds are comfortable and rooms well maintained. I would not let any comments regarding issues at the casino keep you from staying at the hotel. The Hotel Manager, Jamin Rothchild, obviously knows her business. The attached Ruth's Chris Steak is also a plus and very well run. The conference floor is well designed and comfortable for all but the largest groups-we have 260.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Come Here”
Reviews.Author: tapison
Reviews.Content: The room was terrible. The food was not good at all. Employees were not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect St. Patrick's day in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: cubfan01indiana
Reviews.Content: Harrah's New Orleans was fantastic! My husband and I have stayed in many Harrah's properties and this was our favorite. Beautiful room with a view and such a friendly staff! Great quiet location but still loads of fun! I will say, stay away from the buffet...even if it is free YUCK!!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not eat in the buffett at Casino.”
Reviews.Author: leboeufOntario
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok but do not offer enough venues for dining. so we went to casino and food was cold. i got sick on breakfast sausage and had to stay in room for 2 days. vomiting and diaahrea. i was ony one of 4 people who had sausage pattie. food was cold. pies were dried and old.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but only if you're a gambler”
Reviews.Author: GrumbleMuck
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Harrah's New Orleans around 8:00 PM on a Monday. They had apparently oversold the premium, king, non-smoking room I booked, so upgraded me to a suite. I'd have been more impressed had the person at the front desk not initially tried to tell me I'd booked a double, smoking room. Only after I corrected him and showed him a printed copy of my reservation (pre-paid, non-refundable) did they offer the upgrade. While the hotel is lovely, it is lacking in some areas. The only dining options in the hotel are Ruth's Chris Steak House or room service. Want breakfast? Order $30 scrambled eggs delivered to your room or plan to go out. Neither is there an ATM or gift shop where a traveler can pick up forgotten essentials. Admittedly, the hotel is designed to funnel guests to the adjacent casino, but given that the casino is across the street; is a smoke filled cavern and does not admit anyone under 21, the lack of amenities at the hotel itself will prevent me from returning. I certainly could not imagine staying there with children or for any reason other than gambling.

Reviews.Title: “7 stars trip”
Reviews.Author: mda1701
Reviews.Content: nice place only complaint was no pool or spa walking distance to french quater nice restarants

Reviews.Title: “They did it right! Beautiful new suites with amazing view”
Reviews.Author: LA_Nelson22
Reviews.Content: I was invited down to New Orleans by Harrah's and was blown away by the room. Beautiful and spacious, it blows away the Intercontinental supposedly 4 star hotel nearby where I had stayed just 2 months before. The bathroom was the most memorable, with a separate bathtub and shower and marble tiled floors. A great view of the river, free wireless, HD television and luxurious beds, it couldn't have been any better. Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service in the Casino”
Reviews.Author: masizemo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough, but the staff in the casino is TERRIBLE. I spoke with 5 different employee's on a single issue I had. None of them wanted to assist me with the issue. One female employee became angry and confrontational with me. I cashed out and left. I will never go back there again. It is no Las Vegas for sure.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzieo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful SUPER BOWL weekend at Harrahs..Beautiful room,great views of the river.Front desk very friendly and helpful.Just a few blocks from the French Quarter and the many parades(krews) that are going on for Mardi Gras.Besh Steakhouse in Harrahs is great,also Gordon Birsch brewpub has excellent brews and food.Too many thing to do in 5 days,will stay longer next time.Dont forget Dragos resturant at the Hilton for their charbroiled oysters.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: desilu330720
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room-- got in to New Orleans very late on a wednesday night, stayed here since i was comped (i play at Harrarh's in atlantic city so i get room offers at all there hotels) Checked in around 1am,. check out room, lovely, and went to the casino, before going i asked the girl if i could have a late checkout since i was arriving so late and just getting to the tables, she said best she could do was 12pm and i said great. Casino was very nice, and gigantic, one of the nicest harrah's ive ever been too, same can be said about the rooms. Room, service was crazy over priced. Got frantic calls at 11:07 am demanding that i check out and if i don't i will be charged $100 to stay till noon. I protested and told her that the very nice girl who checked me in said that a 12 noon checkout was applied to my reservation. Girl on the phone said there was no record of that, luckily i remembered the check-in girls' name which gave me a little more clout. she said they would do it this time without a fee but next time i would be charged. first of all 11 is very very early for a casino; second, i took care of this the night before and finally $100 for 45 min, you have to be kidding me. Besides that though, my stay was pleasant enough

Reviews.Title: “Best Harrahs hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: TexasWoodman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a weekend trip to New Orleans and could not have been more impressed with this entire Harrahs location. We have visited many of harrahs's locations around the country and New Orleans was the best property we have visited to date. The casino has a wide variety of gaming and entertainment. The premium room we were comped was more than adequate and very comfortable. Every level of service was very professional and I have to say that we did not encounter one person that was less than courteous. The location is great for touring as most locations are within walking distance. We really hope to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience that I have even had in Harrahs buffet”
Reviews.Author: People-like-to-eat
Reviews.Content: I went to Harrahs buffet to enjoy their Christmas night special buffet. But the food is horrible!! One of the special things is the King Carb legs, but what they serve is the "Frozen King Carb legs" They were frozen solid!!! And the famous Oyster is bad "they are mostly bad and dirty" I need to go to restroom when I have the first one. I ask the manager over there, he told me they know about the problem and talk to the cheif already and told me to throw away the frozen carb leg and the Oyster. he told me he will ask chief to make some more out. After 30 minutes I go there and check. Yes the chief has make some more out, but the king carb leg are still frozen just they don't let the customer to pick it, and the oyster is the same old same old "bad bad" oyster!! The Service is horrible, food is horrible. I really cannot go to Harrahs to play if the food and service is like that!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Harrah's Casino Parking Garage”
Reviews.Author: fkcr
Reviews.Content: Harrah's Casino offered us a free room at one of their sister hotels for a night. We stayed at the sister hotel but parked in the Harrah's Casino Parking Garage. During the night our vehicle was stolen out of their parking garage even though I still had my parking ticket and video cameras were present around the garage. Harrah's response" we are not liable for spontaneous criminal activity at our garage. If you would have parked via valet parking they would have been liable. However Harrah's does not offer valet parking. Beware of the parking garage. It is unsafe. After this happened we are hearing of other instances of vehicle theft in the garage. The garage is unsafe. I would still like to know how they made it passed the exit gate and out the garage without a parking ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: grawes715
Reviews.Content: We took our Seven Star trip this month to Harrahs in New Orleans. We were treated great and every member of the staff was very friendly. We had a super nice host, Dana, and would recommend him to everyone. He made sure it was a great trip for us and saw that we had everything we needed. We had a beautiful suite and great food. It was our first trip to New Orleans and it definately won't be our last. I would highly recommend it to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: I had a comped room and stayed here the night before our cruise. We had a luxury room and it was very nice and large. We ate at Grand Isle which is a seafood restaurant on-site which was decent. Note: Parking at the hotel parking garage is $25.00 per night unless you have 30 minutes of tracked play with your player's card. We strolled down to the casino and play for 40 minutes, won $60 on 1 penny Happy Day's machine and called it a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: ilovetrips43
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful rooms, and the staff was excellent

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL-ANGELA FROM SOUTH CAROLINA”
Reviews.Author: southcarolinaangela
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite Harrah's in US. Top class service, wonderful food, and great atmosphere. I just happen to be going again tommorow and I cannot wait to get there. The suites in this hotel are to die for and the food is absolutely delicious. For all the complainers, you must be impossible to satisfy. Some people are just like that. Take it from one that travels very regularly, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deadlghts
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel, superior staff. The bathroom was quite possibly the nicest I've ever seen in a hotel. Spectacular river view. After check in, we were escorted to our room where the valet showed us all of the features and how to work them. Every day we were greeted in the lobby by name, both when adventuring out and when returning. Genuinely warm and kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “The best. All employees were so great, friendly. We are going back in November.”
Reviews.Author: southindy
Reviews.Content: Take a city tour. It is well worth it. The hotel is beautiful. The casino is one of the friendliest we have ever been in. We usually go to Vegas and tried this once. Going back in November!

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Un-informed”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBob
Reviews.Content: During my visit to New Orleans parked at Harrahs to take advantage of the play 30minutes for free parking. Upon entering asked several employees the proper procedure for parking validation. We played our 30 minutes then walked down to Bourbon Street for dinner and some fun. When we came back to leave because we were not staying in New Orleans, the parking attendent was very rude when we didn't have the proper validation and told us to go back into the casino to get it. We were of course id'd several times to get back in creating an even bigger hassle. If they are going to offer validated parking the employees need to be on the same page about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but”
Reviews.Author: partroy27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Harrahs hotels and this one was very nice. The rooms were large with a view of the river, it was conveniently located near the French quarter and the trolley stops. The service was good but spotty. The staff was mostly friendly and helpful. However, the housekeeping was not up to par (left dirty glasses in room, didn't refill tissues etc) requested bell service when leaving but they never arrived. There is no cafe in the hotel. they direct you to the hotel next door if you want a cup of coffee. Room service was very good and prompt. There were plenty of restaurants in the casino and on Fulton street which were very good and convenient. The concierge was very helpful in arranging trips and reservations. Overall it was a good stay and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “staff is grrrrrrrrrrrrreat........”
Reviews.Author: palmbriez
Reviews.Content: the people who work at the hotel really seemed to love their jobs....every morning and evening we were greeted with a welcome.......room was great......view wonderful.....and the gambling was fun......computer available 24/7 with room key.....2401......thanks to all the staff who made our stay grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrreat......

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia1C
Reviews.Content: Please don't waste your time here! All the ticket redemption machines were broke and the lines for the cashiers were EXTREMELY long, and they had "someone" directing traffic to the windows which was total chaos!!! That "someone" was very rude and did not want to give anyone the time of day. Where do I begin as far as the buffet - just simply horrific!!! The slot machines do not even take 1 dollar bills, that should tell ya something! Bad, Bad, Bad!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chapmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here Sept. 20,21st. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and check-in was very efficient. The parking attendent at valet even informed us of the choices to park and how to park free if we got our ticket validated in the casino. Rooms were very nice, large and well equipped. There was always staff present in the lobby any time of the day or night. The hotel is connected by an underground walkway to the casino. We felt very safe any time of the day or night walking to and from the casino. There are many restaurants and nightlife within walking distance close proximity of the hotel. Casino is close to shopping and the riverfront. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay -- would do it again in a heartbeat!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationers904
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early for our stay and were offered a room immediately (lower floors). When we requested a higher floor were asked to wait and leave our cell number --- we were called in a matter of 20-30 minutes when the room was ready. Rooms were very nice, bed quite comfortable. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating or courteous, we have stayed at Harrah's resorts in Las Vegas, Atlantic City and in Lake Tahoe - none came close to the staff in New Orleans - whether it was 1:00 in the afternoon or 2:00 in the morning. Selection of restuarants on the premises was enough to meet everyone's taste -- however, if you do not like Starbucks - no other place for breakfast (except Buffet) - only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: Bummer99
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for Harrah's hotel several months prior to my stay. After a long drive, I arrived at the hotel only to find that they had drastically oversold and I would be re-routed to one of their partner properties. They have several lovely partner properties, however, my pre-trip logistics plans were all shot to hell, not to mention the risk to life and limb (and wallet) walking the streets between hotel and casino as only Harrah's has the tunnel between hotel and casino (with security). This is my second similar experience with the Harrah's properties in New Orleans. Beware to the potential guest...you don't always get what you book!! My best advice...arrive really early if you book Harrah's. Arrivals were being re-routed to other properties as early as 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “SAVE YOUR MONEY GO SOMEWHERE ELSE !! BOTTOM LINE”
Reviews.Author: Arkansas62
Reviews.Content: the room are nice, but everything else is a money trap,the food in the casino is a joke, food look like it was sitting out all day, too $$and they will not comp you like their other casinos,remind me of the pan handlers on bourbon street, always with their hands out,, wanting something for nothing,,To harrah's management.,Take pride in your new orleans casino, instead of useing it to float your other casinos and ripping people off !! yours will only be the loser in the long run!!

Reviews.Title: “Are we talking about the same place?”
Reviews.Author: FitWhiz
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at Harrahs. I stay at various casino properties throughout the country. The Harrahs New Orleans is absolutely one of the best! The hotel is beautiful, the staff friendly and helpful, and the food is excellent! I enjoyed myself so much that I decided to go back to Harrahs New Orleans rather than Vegas this summer- and I am bringing my brother- who loves New Orleans. I have never had to wait for my room- and have always been earlier than 4PM. The only negative is the smoke- but I guess it's only wishful thinking that Louisianna would go smoke-free like Illinois has.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back”
Reviews.Author: subya
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at Harrah's Hotel (didn't have the days available) but we stayed at the sister hotel, Hilton. I did go to Harrah's Hotel to check it out. A very nice woman offered me a tour. The rooms looked great. Very friendly people. At the casino, the fast food places were open and provided some variety. The buffet was good. I did like the crab legs and other local foods on the menu. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a wide variety of slot machines available. I was not a winner during my stay. I felt that very few people won. I see people write about tight machines and Harrah's in New Orleans belongs in this group. I would return but would probably stay at the Hilton, if available. It had a lot to offer. If you go to Drago's restaurant in the Hilton ask for Patrica, a wonderful waitress that has a lot of tips about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Break-in at garage”
Reviews.Author: dscOntario
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at Harrah's and parked in the above ground garage for the full stay. First off, rooms are fine and the staff friendly. Casino is average and what you expect. My big problem is this place is really not as safe as you might think or expect. Was on the eight floor of parking garage and four vechiles had their windows smashd by people looking for GPS or any other valuables. Did not find this until the morning we were leaving, according to security, out of state plates make you a target in New Orleans. Security said that this happened between 6 to 7 pm at night (yes in full daylight) and that is when they found the break-ins. No attempt is made to find the owners or call police, in fact there was still one more car sitting with the broken window when I left that morning. Found out that the garage has no cameras, which I would expect in a high end casino/hotel. I have attempted to call the hotel to see if some compensation is available, nobody calls back. Bottom line, beware of the city. Not a pleasant way to finish a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paid a high price not to sleep at all !!”
Reviews.Author: nblnde1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed July 2-July 4th am. Rates were high for Holiday weekend but booked anyway. July 3rd we couldn't sleep because of a very very loud band or DJ below our window. We were in room 712 it was so loud the window vibrated. This continued to about 4am. We complained that night and at check out but was brushed off. We spent $1422.oo for the two nights and some roomservice. My husband is 75 it was his birthday, what a bumber he couldn't even sleep the evening of July 3rd. Needless to say we will go back to the Windsor Court from this day on. We are local and visit New Oreans often.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; few complaints”
Reviews.Author: stjoesun
Reviews.Content: After hearing that this hotel was "the best of the best" from a fellow traveler, I was bound to be disappointed. The hotel room was luxurious and quiet. The bed was fabulous. The staff was friendly. Complaints: Our room was barely cleaned and it was disappointing. New Orleans was super-hot when were there and the room could barely be kept cool We had to keep the blinds closed just to be able to stand it. Admittedly, I did not complain to the management about either of these things. I do believe they would have been remedied had I spoken up. My husband waited in line 2 different times but was never able to use the business center. Also, beware of the VERY expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room with a View!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTJ
Reviews.Content: As Reward Card holders we were comped 4 nights, so not much to complain about. The room was very clean, was called non-smoking but stunk of smoke (have they not heard of Fabreeze?) truly the only complaint about the room. Location was great, overlooking the MIssissippi, 1 block to the street car, walking distance to Bourbon Street. Had an early flight, arrived at 11AM couldn't check in until 3PM. To our dismay our luggage was left on a cart in the lobby where anyone could have walked off with it. I was not happy...husband has condition which requires daily meds, which they were aware of when we left the luggage ( I hesitated to leave the small bag with meds, but was assured it would be safe). Front desk clerk(Angela? Angeline?) could use a class or two in friendliness but the ONLY person that was not welcoming and pleasant. Casino slots paid out NOTHING...not a bell rung in 4 days anywhere in the place!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: b43147
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrah's N.O. May 2009 for 3 nights. I cannot think of one problem to write about. From the time we checked in around noon to the time we had late check out at noon 3 days later we were treated extremely well. Ok, one thing. The elevators are a little tricky with the key card. But, a minor detail. The beds were absolutely fabulous. The most comfortable that I have ever slept on. We had a nice view of the river from our 14th floor room. The shower is separate from the beautiful large bathtub. There is a Ruth Chris Steakhouse in the hotel lobby. The casino is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel but it is completely covered. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: dvg_loves_cali
Reviews.Content: I had been in the casino of this hotel during a previous stay and based on that I did not have high expectations for the hotel. However, I was pleasantly surprised. It was the Christmas season and the hotel spent a good amount of effort decorating. The room itself was more modern than I expected and fairly spacious. The location is not ideal for spending time in the French Quarter, as its a fair walk. However, we were able to head over without too much extra effort. It's just not as nice as being in a hotel located closer to the center. Valet parking and concierge were both great, but self-parking was a nightmare on the weekend when lots of people came for the gaming. The garage almost filled up, and it is a very big garage. We had the buffet at the casino (mediocre) and dinner at the Ruth's Chris in the hotel (too expensive for basically steak and a potato). There is also a Gordon Biersch brewery nearby and a couple of other places, so there are some limited options for food if you don't want room service. We happened to stay at Harrah's as a guest of the hotel, so it was extremely cheap, but for a regular rate of $170 I feel I'd look elsewhere unless you think you will do a lot of gambling. However, the gaming was not good, with the table minimums set very high. I can find cheaper games at the Bellagio. I rate this hotel 3 stars, because I think that as nice as it is the Loews had more of a boutique feel and cost less (about $70 less!) for a very similar stay. Harrah's is about a block or two closer than Loews and has more closer to it, but it's not worth the extra price and represents a poor value at rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and Sour”
Reviews.Author: Brieryle
Reviews.Content: There is no middle ground at this strange property. The rooms and public areas are beautifully appointed. The staff is super-friendly and very capable. BUT, there is not a general restaurant, coffee shop, not even a Starbucks in this place. There is no gift shop, not even a newsstand here. No pool, no health club, you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: blackjack6631
Reviews.Content: this is the only thing in Louisiana that comes close to the nicer hotels in Vegas.All the other hotel/casinos in LA are ghetto compared to this place.the location was perfect.was our first trip to New Orleans.we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and amateurish desk clerk and concierge”
Reviews.Author: BJBArlington_texas
Reviews.Content: I knew I would be arriving prior to the 4 pm check in time, so I called the concierge and asked what would be the earliest we could possibly get a room. He told me to come at 11:30 since many people were checking out early that morning and housekeeping would have several rooms cleaned by then. My son and I arrived at 11:30 and attempted to check in. The desk clerk was loud and argumentative and told me that no one at Harrahs would have given me this information and that check in was at 4 pm without exception. Several other customers were within earshot. I felt humiliated. After some heated negotiating, I was handed the key to a room and was allowed to check in. Why I had to go through this I will never understand. As she handed me the key I was chastised further with a, "Next time you should know you can't check in before 4 pm." Unfortunately, my stay was colored by this unfortunate first impression. I will say that the bell staff were some of the nicest I have encountered. The room was pretty and clean. The mattresses and bedding were only average. The casino staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing And Pleasant Memories”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyDixielover
Reviews.Content: We traveled from New Jersey to New Orleans, La., and were greeted with friendly smiles upon our arrival. We were checked into the hotel immediately and found our room to be absolutely stunning looking , and the beds and pillows made it easy for our tired traveled bodies to fall asleep easily. We loved the Casino and found everyone to be happy and very accommodating in helping us to learn our way around the area. . We were able to book a bus tour at the Harrah's Hotel and totally enjoyed the bus tour We love our Atlantic City Harrah's, but New Orleans Harrah's definitely out-shines the Atlantic City Harrah's with its hotel room comfors and warm hospitality of its employees. . We can't wait to visit New Orleans Harrah's Hotel again!! Thanks for great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most hospitable Hotel or Casino to stay in”
Reviews.Author: reneg8de50
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Harrahs hotel prior to heading to Biloxi on Vacation, we should have just went straight to Biloxi. Personnel in the Hotel made us feel like we owed them something, or that it was a problem to help us. The casino was dark and dingy with a lot of what I would have called vagrants just hanging around inside. The food at the casino was good. Was not a pleasant stay for myself or my wife and we could not check out soon enough. The people around New Orlenas had the same attitude, versus Biloxi who had more devastation hit htme "5 years ago" than New Orleans, but in Biloxi they aren;t looking at the past, only trying to do something for their future! You won;t see my wife or I going back there anytime soon, It will be another 8 years before we think about going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Luxury Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katalina5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at Harrah's New Orleans. I thought the hotel was lovely!! The staff could not have been more attentive or welcoming. From the moment we arrived they were helpful and processed our reservation quickly and we were in our room in minutes. The room was spacious and very clean with a nice view of the river. The front desk was always helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. The hotel is in a great location right off of Canal and only a few blocks from the French Quarter. I felt very safe walking at night with my daughter and everything was located close by. I liked that the Hotel was seperate from the casino because it felt more private and was much quieter than other casino hotes I've stayed in. I would definatedly recommend this hotel for location, rooms and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Harrahs Hotel was Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: katalina5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at Harrah's Hotel in New Orleans. I thought it was the nicest casino hotel I have ever stayed in. It is seperate from the casino so it is much more private and quiet. The staff could not have been nicer or more welcoming. They were extremely helpful with all directions and restaurant recommendations . It is in the perfect location right by the Warehouse District and only a few short blocks from the French Quarter. A very safe area and no problem walking to everything at night. I could not recomend it more highly we had a wondrful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Concierge & bad room”
Reviews.Author: JMo36
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for the jazz fest and booked the hotel a month before going there. Our room was $450/night i requested a water view high floor nonsmoking. When we got there they gave us a handicap rm on the 5th floor! I called the concierge for restraunt recomendations-I was placed on hold for 20 mins then she referred us to a place that once we arrived found out it was closed on Monday nights we ended up eating at the Hard Rock Cafe. Check out the Lowes hotel or the W that are both right across the street from Harrahs and the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: dracer2689
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Harrahs and thought everything was lovely. Staff was friendly and casino was great. Only regret was the high priced room service menu and NO free valet parking. We have NEVER had to pay for valet at any Harrahs with our Diamond status.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall”
Reviews.Author: player9
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Harrah's since the opening. There is no comparison to any of the other hotels I have stayed in New Orleans. The comfort and hospitality is second to none. The rooms are clean and oversized. The service was great. The restaurants are wonderful. Harrahs' has always gone out of their way to be sure my stay was a great one. I have been to Las Vegas, Reno, Tahoe and New Orleans is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, generic yet spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: MadokaRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NOLA and stayed at Harrah's. The location was super convenient to the French Quarter and the Garden District (via streetcar). We loved that it was right off Canal thru the casino. Safety was no problem at all. You have to have a room key to even get the elevators to move. We walked from the Quarter via St. Peter's without any problems. It was about 15minutes walking to get to Jackson Square and 5-7 minutes to get to the street car stop on St. Charles. The bathroom was nice with the soaking tub and separate shower. We were in room 703--which was close to the elevator and had a partial view of the river. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed that we have slept in. The staff was very attentive and helpful. We loved that the casino was easily accessible thru the underground tunnel since it was a little cold in the morning. The only complaint was the buffet. The food was not that great but it was convenient late at night. The casino was fairly good to us. I did win enough that I broke even even though I played many hours during my down time in NOLA. I would stay at Harrahs New Orleans again for a nice place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: richmed
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NOLA and I was pleasantly surprised. The Hotel is beautiful and very clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. It had a nice choice of restaurants, but besides the ones on site the area is loaded with great places to eat. It is in an ideal location, a few blocks from the French Quarter and a street car ride from the Garden district. The casino was as lose as the other Harrah's casinos In AC, Vegas, and Biloxi. However, they did not offer large jackpots. The largest I noticed was $15,000.00. I honestly had no complaints, we had a wonderful three day stay.

Reviews.Title: “casino poor, hotel terrific, restaurant horrible”
Reviews.Author: 123456789customer10
Reviews.Content: The casino was dirty, the staff rude, & 1/2 the machines were broken. The hotel was clean, the staff pleasant, and the room was very nice. John Besh Restaurant in the Casino was HORRIBLE!!! The glasses were dirty, the cuts of meat well below average, and the experience was BAD!

Reviews.Title: “Good for free but not great”
Reviews.Author: mymorgan2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were comped three nights we booked it over the phone however, when we arrived we found out our three nights were in THREE DIFFERENT HOTELS! Every morning we had to check out of a room load the bags in the car and then check in later in the day. Hotel one was doubletree very small rooms but friendly staff. Hotel two was Harrah's room was nice as well as hotel staff. Hotel three was Hilton Riverside first room was wrong bed type, second room had broken ac/heater, third room was small as were all the others but comfy. I will only go back if I stay in the Harrah's rooms for my whole trip. Food at casino buffet was average, the Besh Steakhouse was good however very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and GREAT Beds!”
Reviews.Author: HowdyDudes
Reviews.Content: Harrah's actually has information in their rooms for how to order your own mattress like theirs -- they must get lots of inquiries! The beds were amazing and that just topped off a very nice stay in a very nice hotel. The staff was great, the location was great, and we had no complaints. The only thing I would say is that I wouldn't have paid $400 a night to stay there. Because we were there for a tournament in the casino, our rooms were comped, but if we had been paying the regular $400 rate I would have felt that it was a over-priced. It was a wonderful stay, but not $400 of wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms wonderful; casino and staff awful”
Reviews.Author: Librarian53
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to NOLA to say at Harrahs. Our previous trips always went fairly well. The rooms are luxury rooms with great amenities. The hotel staff have benn accomadating when we asked for a room close to the elevator and good views. The food court is not the best. Very expensive and food is mediocre. We ate twice at the steak house in the casino and both times I got sick, second time with severe vomiting. Won't eat there again!! In out other stays the casino was ok. Some of my favorite machines from previous visits were gone and replaced with newer, tighter machines. On our last stay I had a ticket for $490 that I was trying to cash at the redemption center. It wouldn't cash the ticket and I went to the cashier cage. There I was told that the ticket had already been cashed and there was nothing they could do for me. I asked to speak to the supervisor and was told the same thing. I kept going up the chain and was then told that the ticket had been played out on a machine. (How would I have had the ticket if that had happened???) I kept at it because I had not cashed the ticket or played it out and felt like they were trying to rip me off. I kept asking to speak to someone higher and for them to pull their security tapes, zoom in on the machine they thought I had played the ticket out on. Finally, after about an hour and half later, the manager on duty of the casino agreed to pay out the ticket, this time the excuse was that the slot machine sent the wrong message to the computer. Overall this whole incident was very upsetting. I decided at that time that I would not be a repeat customer at NOLA again. The staff at the casino cage were uncaring and rude. We drove 8 hours to play and stay at NOLA. We have since picked several other casino chains as our NEW casino of choice to play at. NOLA will not see us again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place, don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Charleston53
Reviews.Content: Just for fun we gave it a try. Not run well at all. Machines broken and no one around to help. Slots especially bad. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time at Harrahs”
Reviews.Author: megd80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrahs with my aunt, and we got a great deal mainly because of her rewards points from other Harrahs casinos. The hotel room was very comfortable and it was very easy to get to the casino from the hotels. The casino was not the most impressive casino, but it wasnt bad. The Hotel is located right by Canal Street on the edge of the French Quarter. Not so great for walking back at night, but definatly a decent location. IT is a large hotel, which is unlike most of hte hotels you will find in the French Quarter. While it is not a budget hotel, if you are able to it is definatly a good place to stay while inn NOLA. IF you are driving, parking was very expensive. One drawback is that there is no swimming pool..as our stay was in July..that would have been a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review on room, casino is a JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: Stephagrl
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel staff for the most part. They were wonderful. They remembered my name after the check-in throughout my stay. They were very accomodating and gracious. We were there for 4 days Feb 26-Mar 1 2009. The room was a comp that my friends received because of their status as casino players. I hadn't gambled in 8 years. So I took along $1300.00 of which I earned a WHOPPING GRAND TOTAL OF $5.00 In rewards!!!! The room itself was very nice, it had a built in media/closet and a safe box which was handy. The hallways were littered with trays for days. It would take ALL day long for them to be removed (that is just plain GROSS!) The housekeeping lady was sitting on the floor at 9am or so when I passed her, I came back around 10:15.........STILL SITTING THERE ON HER CELL PHONE BLABBING! Even if she was on break, it should have been done OUT of view! Oh and if you don't turn on your light you wont get your room cleaned and even if you do, you had best plan on being gone a LONG time. I came back 4 times during the day, finally I told the young lady to just refresh my towels and to take the food tray ( she placed it in the hallway where it sat for 15 hours.) There were a few problems, had I not visited my friends room next door I wouldn't have KNOWN that I wasn't given the duvet comforter (which would have been nice.) My door broke the 2nd night we were there, the return arm fell. Thank God it didn't fall on ME! It weighed about 25 lbs and was dangerous! The casino had very expensive dining. The Casino eateries SUCK! Bambu should be named Shamu. Was some of the WORST food ever created. The buffett is GROSS and institutional. The Hotel has a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, that was fabulous, across the way is Gordon Biersch, it was also absolutely fabulous and the food was amazing. Highly recommend both of these. Also Adelaide's at Loew's Hotel was some of the best food I have EVER had in my life. All in all the hotel was OK........the staff beyond housekeeping was great, but the Casino was the WORST. I expect to LOSE $..........just not so damn fast! It wasn't even fun! There were thugs EVERYWHERE and the security is scary.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamadasmith
Reviews.Content: In my recent visit to the Harrah's Casino, I found the quality of employee lacking in many of the skills they need to have to properly execute their job. I have never run across a dealer at a empty table game not willing to teach you how to play the game. She had nothing else to do. Maybe it was because she could barely speak english. It also helps to have security personel that can carry a box of chips without recklessly spilling drinks all over the players. I have never been to a casino where the employees were so inconsiderate of the people PAYING THEIR SALARIES!!! If their job was to see how far they could roll their eyes back in their head, they deserve a raise. Not everyone that worked there was like this. Ricky, the poker room captain, and many of the dealers and servers were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the parking garage!”
Reviews.Author: Terry1947
Reviews.Content: The Harrah's garage was completely full with vehicles parked in non-parking spaces and with some vehicles occupying two spaces. Unable to find a space, I parked on the end of a row, not blocking anything, because others had done the same thing. When I returned to my vehicle, it was booted. I contacted security and two attendants came and told me I had to pay them $250 cash to remove the boot. This seemed like a scam to me so I went to the security office in the casino and I asked why all the other vehicles that were similarly parked were not booted too, I was told they did not have enough boots. The security manager was very sarcastic and told me I had to go back and pay the two attendants $250 if I wanted to have my vehicle released. I refused to hand over $250 cash to some strangers in the garage. The manager made a call to someone and I was then told I could pay the money at the cash cage. I had to pay in order to get my vehicle. It is highly unfair and poor policy to penalize only a few people and let dozens of others slide just because Harrah's is too cheap to buy enough boots. Either boot everyone or no one. This was a very unpleasant experience for me, especially since I had guests with me. I will never make the mistake of going to Harrah's again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stays in 2008”
Reviews.Author: ldrron
Reviews.Content: I am a Seven Stars player and only play at Harrahs Hotels in New Orleans, Tunica, Atlantic City, and Las vegas. Sometimes I go with a Harrahs travel group and sometimes I contact the Hotels directly. My Airfare, Hotel and (usually food) are always comped. I love Harrahs New Orleans. The hotel is beautiful. I get a big kick out of having a doorbell for my suite and an inside the room operated Do Not Disturb button. The Suites are roomy and well equiped. I especially like the bathrooms. The Casino personnel are friendly and go out of their way to be of service. I am not big on spicy foods.... but the Hotel food here is so good that I don't mind it being spicy. I am going again this coming weekend February 6 and am looking forward to another excellent trip. Ron Charlotte, N.C.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of jackpots in New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: Loizee
Reviews.Content: Love New Orleans! Slots are lose and comps are great. Casino staff in high roller slot room extra nice. Would go again in a heart beat. Besh steakhouse has great steaks and seafood some weird selections on menu if you want that southern stuff. Rooms were very nice, hotel didn't have a spa or pool, ok because we have one in our backyard. Was quite leary about our safety before we came, but their were gaurds on every door and area around hotel very clean and safe. Please send us another offer New Orleans! Sevan Star and Diamond members from Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: big_D123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrah's for three nights over Christmas. I am Rewards Member and my room had been comped but they 'convinced' me to upgrade to one of their suites. Since my stay would have been free, I didn't need that much convincing ;-). But it was well worth it. It was a corner suite on the 24th floor facing the French Quarter on one side and the river on the other. Very nice suite - separate bedroom, huge marble bathroom, turn down service, good housekeeping. Very friendly people at the check-in and bell hopp. Nothing to complain about at all. It's right off Canal Street and close to the Convention Center and the River Walk. French Quarter also only 15 minutes to walk . Hotel does not have a restaurant that serves breakfast (only Ruth Chris Steakhouse is on the premises) but right outside the door is a Gordon Biersch brewery with excellent food starting at 11 am. Hotel is connected via underground walk-way to the neighboring casino so you don't have to cross the busy street in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: Mingospanky
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel was excellent. From the hotel desk to the buffet staff, I couldn't have been treated nicer. Room was clean, modern and spacious, marble bathrooms with separate glass shower and garden tub, very comfortable bed and prompt room service. Located one block from Riverwalk shops and four blocks to Bourbon St, and Cafe du Monde, never used the car. I've stayed in Las Vegas/Atlantic City, Harrahs and found this to be the friendliest. Defintely would stay again when I get back to New Orleans!
